title_narrative: ASSAINISSEMENT DE LA VILLE DE NIAMEY,Assainissement de la Ville de Niamey
description_narrative: Le projet d'assainissement de la ville de Niamey vise l'amlioration des conditions sanitaires\, sociale et conomiques dans trois quartiers populeux de cette ville\, par la mise en place d'un systme unitaire d'vacuation des eaux pluviales et des eaux uses d'origine mnagre uniquement. Grce  l'acquisition de matriel et quipement d'entretien et  la ralisation d'un programme de formation du personnel\, il permettra galement le renforcement des moyens d'intervention de la Mairie\, organe d'exploitation. Le projet\, volet du plan directeur d'assainissement de la ville de niamey\, une fois ralis\, contribuera  la satisfaction des besoins de la population des quartiers concrens jusqu'a l'horizon 2000.
participating_org_narrative: African Development Fund,Government Of Niger,MINISTERE DU PLAN,MINISTERE DU PLAN
sector: Water sector policy and administrative management
sector_narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management

title_narrative: Niger - National Rural Drinking Water Supply and Sanitation Programme (NRDWSSP) (Phase II: Second Sub-Programme - 2011-2014),Niger - Programme national dapprovisionnement en eau potable et dassainissement en milieu rural (PNAEPA) (Phase II : Deuxime sous-programme - 2011-2014)
description_narrative: The proposed rural drinking water supply and sanitation (WATSAN) subprogramme operates in all 11 departments of the two regions concerned (Tillabry and Dosso). These provinces are among the poorest in the country\, with a high proportion of the population of 70% for both regions compared to the national average of 60%\, below the poverty line. This sub-programme\, while part of a process of ongoing consultation with the main donors of the water sector in the country\, constitutes the second phase of the Bank's AEPA Initiative in rural Niger. At the same time\, it is a full-fledged entity of the country's National Rural Drinking Water and Sanitation Programme for 2020 (PNAEPA). The main expected accomplishments of the subprogramme at the end of the 36-month period foreseen for its implementation are: (i) 9881 new individual latrines for the most vulnerable families; (ii) 9881 washing bins and hand-washing facilities; (iii) 295 new multi-compartment latrines\, built in village public infrastructure (schools\, health centres and other public places); (iv) 99 water supply structures and networks; (v) 297 new boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps; (vi) 130 boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps\, rehabilitated; (vii) 300 masons trained in latrine construction techniques; (viii) 300 female relays and 150 school teachers trained in hygiene and prevention at the village level; (ix) 99 associations of public water service users (AUSPE) and 427 water point management committees (CGPE) set up\, run and trained in the management and maintenance of water points; (x) some 30 private operators supported and trained in the operation and maintenance of complex AEP networks; (xi) 50 artisanal borehole repairers trained and equipped with recovery equipment through pumping equipment contracts; and (xii) training\, facilitation and awareness-raising campaigns carried out in nearly 526 localities in the two subprogramme regions. The estimated pre-tax cost of the subprogramme is UA 34.069 million.,Le prsent sous-programme dalimentation en eau potable et dassainissement (AEPA) en milieu rural intervient dans lensemble des 11 dpartements des deux rgions concernes (Tillabry et Dosso). Ces provinces comptent parmi les plus pauvres du pays\, avec une forte proportion de la population 70% pour les deux rgions contre 60% en moyenne nationale\, en dessous du seuil de pauvret. Ce sous-programme\, tout en sinscrivant dans une dynamique de concertation permanente avec les principaux bailleurs du secteur de leau dans le pays\, constitue la seconde phase de lInitiative AEPA de la Banque en milieu rural au Niger. Dans le mme temps\, il constitue une entit  part entire du Programme National dEau Potable et dAssainissement en milieu rural du pays  lhorizon 2020 (PNAEPA). Les principales ralisations attendues du sous-programme au terme de la priode de 36 mois prvue pour sa ralisation\, sont : (i) 9881 nouvelles latrines individuelles pour les familles les plus vulnrables; (ii) 9881 bacs  laver et dispositifs de lavemains ; (iii) 295 nouvelles latrines multi-compartiments\, construites au niveau des infrastructures publiques villageoises (coles\, centres de sant et autres lieux publics); (iv) 99 ouvrages et rseaux dAEP; (v) 297 nouveaux forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine ; (vi) 130 forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine\, rhabilits ; (vii) 300 maons forms aux techniques de construction des latrines; (viii) 300 relais fminins et 150 matres dcoles forms sur les thmes de lhygine et de la prvention au niveau des villages; (ix) 99 associations des usagers du service public de leau (AUSPE) et 427 comits de gestion de points deau (CGPE) mis en place\, anims et forms  la gestion et  lentretien des points deau; (x) une trentaine doprateurs privs appuys et forms  lexploitation et  la maintenance de rseaux dAEP complexes; (xi) 50 artisans rparateurs de forages forms et dots en matriel de dpannage par le biais des contrats dquipements de pompage; et (xii) des campagnes de formation\, animation et sensibilisation ralises dans prs de 526 localits des deux rgions du sous-programme. Le cot estimatif hors taxe du sous-programme est de 34\,069 millions dUC.,Due to the nature of the works put in place\, the subprogramme will allow\, among other things: (i) improving the availability and quality of drinking water; (ii) reducing the difficulty of carrying water\, especially for women; (iii) reducing the cost of water; (iv) reducing the prevalence rate of waterborne diseases; and (v) promoting water-related income-generating activities. Indeed\, the community work approach recommended for the construction of family latrines will allow rural artisans to participate fully in the construction of the works.,De par la nature des ouvrages mis en place\, le sous-programme permettra entre autres : (i) lamlioration de la disponibilit et de la qualit de leau de consommation; (ii) la rduction de la pnibilit du portage de leau\, notamment pour les femmes; (iii) la rduction du cot de leau; (iv) la rduction du taux de prvalence des maladies dorigine hydrique; et (v) la promotion des activits gnratrices de revenus lies  leau. En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

title_narrative: Niger - National Rural Drinking Water Supply and Sanitation Programme (NRDWSSP) (Phase II: Second Sub-Programme - 2011-2014),Niger - Programme national dapprovisionnement en eau potable et dassainissement en milieu rural (PNAEPA) (Phase II : Deuxime sous-programme - 2011-2014)
description_narrative: The proposed rural drinking water supply and sanitation (WATSAN) subprogramme operates in all 11 departments of the two regions concerned (Tillabry and Dosso). These provinces are among the poorest in the country\, with a high proportion of the population of 70% for both regions compared to the national average of 60%\, below the poverty line. This sub-programme\, while part of a process of ongoing consultation with the main donors of the water sector in the country\, constitutes the second phase of the Bank's AEPA Initiative in rural Niger. At the same time\, it is a full-fledged entity of the country's National Rural Drinking Water and Sanitation Programme for 2020 (PNAEPA). The main expected accomplishments of the subprogramme at the end of the 36-month period foreseen for its implementation are: (i) 9881 new individual latrines for the most vulnerable families; (ii) 9881 washing bins and hand-washing facilities; (iii) 295 new multi-compartment latrines\, built in village public infrastructure (schools\, health centres and other public places); (iv) 99 water supply structures and networks; (v) 297 new boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps; (vi) 130 boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps\, rehabilitated; (vii) 300 masons trained in latrine construction techniques; (viii) 300 female relays and 150 school teachers trained in hygiene and prevention at the village level; (ix) 99 associations of public water service users (AUSPE) and 427 water point management committees (CGPE) set up\, run and trained in the management and maintenance of water points; (x) some 30 private operators supported and trained in the operation and maintenance of complex AEP networks; (xi) 50 artisanal borehole repairers trained and equipped with recovery equipment through pumping equipment contracts; and (xii) training\, facilitation and awareness-raising campaigns carried out in nearly 526 localities in the two subprogramme regions. The estimated pre-tax cost of the subprogramme is UA 34.069 million.,Le prsent sous-programme dalimentation en eau potable et dassainissement (AEPA) en milieu rural intervient dans lensemble des 11 dpartements des deux rgions concernes (Tillabry et Dosso). Ces provinces comptent parmi les plus pauvres du pays\, avec une forte proportion de la population 70% pour les deux rgions contre 60% en moyenne nationale\, en dessous du seuil de pauvret. Ce sous-programme\, tout en sinscrivant dans une dynamique de concertation permanente avec les principaux bailleurs du secteur de leau dans le pays\, constitue la seconde phase de lInitiative AEPA de la Banque en milieu rural au Niger. Dans le mme temps\, il constitue une entit  part entire du Programme National dEau Potable et dAssainissement en milieu rural du pays  lhorizon 2020 (PNAEPA). Les principales ralisations attendues du sous-programme au terme de la priode de 36 mois prvue pour sa ralisation\, sont : (i) 9881 nouvelles latrines individuelles pour les familles les plus vulnrables; (ii) 9881 bacs  laver et dispositifs de lavemains ; (iii) 295 nouvelles latrines multi-compartiments\, construites au niveau des infrastructures publiques villageoises (coles\, centres de sant et autres lieux publics); (iv) 99 ouvrages et rseaux dAEP; (v) 297 nouveaux forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine ; (vi) 130 forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine\, rhabilits ; (vii) 300 maons forms aux techniques de construction des latrines; (viii) 300 relais fminins et 150 matres dcoles forms sur les thmes de lhygine et de la prvention au niveau des villages; (ix) 99 associations des usagers du service public de leau (AUSPE) et 427 comits de gestion de points deau (CGPE) mis en place\, anims et forms  la gestion et  lentretien des points deau; (x) une trentaine doprateurs privs appuys et forms  lexploitation et  la maintenance de rseaux dAEP complexes; (xi) 50 artisans rparateurs de forages forms et dots en matriel de dpannage par le biais des contrats dquipements de pompage; et (xii) des campagnes de formation\, animation et sensibilisation ralises dans prs de 526 localits des deux rgions du sous-programme. Le cot estimatif hors taxe du sous-programme est de 34\,069 millions dUC.,Due to the nature of the works put in place\, the subprogramme will allow\, among other things: (i) improving the availability and quality of drinking water; (ii) reducing the difficulty of carrying water\, especially for women; (iii) reducing the cost of water; (iv) reducing the prevalence rate of waterborne diseases; and (v) promoting water-related income-generating activities. Indeed\, the community work approach recommended for the construction of family latrines will allow rural artisans to participate fully in the construction of the works.,De par la nature des ouvrages mis en place\, le sous-programme permettra entre autres : (i) lamlioration de la disponibilit et de la qualit de leau de consommation; (ii) la rduction de la pnibilit du portage de leau\, notamment pour les femmes; (iii) la rduction du cot de leau; (iv) la rduction du taux de prvalence des maladies dorigine hydrique; et (v) la promotion des activits gnratrices de revenus lies  leau. En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

description_narrative: The proposed rural drinking water supply and sanitation (WATSAN) subprogramme operates in all 11 departments of the two regions concerned (Tillabry and Dosso). These provinces are among the poorest in the country\, with a high proportion of the population of 70% for both regions compared to the national average of 60%\, below the poverty line. This sub-programme\, while part of a process of ongoing consultation with the main donors of the water sector in the country\, constitutes the second phase of the Bank's AEPA Initiative in rural Niger. At the same time\, it is a full-fledged entity of the country's National Rural Drinking Water and Sanitation Programme for 2020 (PNAEPA). En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

Les principales ralisations attendues du sous-programme au terme de la priode de 36 mois prvue pour sa ralisation\, sont : (i) 9881 nouvelles latrines individuelles pour les familles les plus vulnrables; (ii) 9881 bacs  laver et dispositifs de lavemains ; (iii) 295 nouvelles latrines multi-compartiments\, construites au niveau des infrastructures publiques villageoises (coles\, centres de sant et autres lieux publics); (iv) 99 ouvrages et rseaux dAEP; (v) 297 nouveaux forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine ; (vi) 130 forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine\, rhabilits ; (vii) 300 maons forms aux techniques de construction des latrines; (viii) 300 relais fminins et 150 matres dcoles forms sur les thmes de lhygine et de la prvention au niveau des villages; (ix) 99 associations des usagers du service public de leau (AUSPE) et 427 comits de gestion de points deau (CGPE) mis en place\, anims et forms  la gestion et  lentretien des points deau; (x) une trentaine doprateurs privs appuys et forms  lexploitation et  la maintenance de rseaux dAEP complexes; (xi) 50 artisans rparateurs de forages forms et dots en matriel de dpannage par le biais des contrats dquipements de pompage; et (xii) des campagnes de formation\, animation et sensibilisation ralises dans prs de 526 localits des deux rgions du sous-programme. Le cot estimatif hors taxe du sous-programme est de 34\,069 millions dUC.,Due to the nature of the works put in place\, the subprogramme will allow\, among other things: (i) improving the availability and quality of drinking water; (ii) reducing the difficulty of carrying water\, especially for women; (iii) reducing the cost of water; (iv) reducing the prevalence rate of waterborne diseases; and (v) promoting water-related income-generating activities. Indeed\, the community work approach recommended for the construction of family latrines will allow rural artisans to participate fully in the construction of the works.,De par la nature des ouvrages mis en place\, le sous-programme permettra entre autres : (i) lamlioration de la disponibilit et de la qualit de leau de consommation; (ii) la rduction de la pnibilit du portage de leau\, notamment pour les femmes; (iii) la rduction du cot de leau; (iv) la rduction du taux de prvalence des maladies dorigine hydrique; et (v) la promotion des activits gnratrices de revenus lies  leau. En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

The main expected accomplishments of the subprogramme at the end of the 36-month period foreseen for its implementation are: (i) 9881 new individual latrines for the most vulnerable families; (ii) 9881 washing bins and hand-washing facilities; (iii) 295 new multi-compartment latrines\, built in village public infrastructure (schools\, health centres and other public places); (iv) 99 water supply structures and networks; (v) 297 new boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps; (vi) 130 boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps\, rehabilitated; (vii) 300 masons trained in latrine construction techniques; (viii) 300 female relays and 150 school teachers trained in hygiene and prevention at the village level; (ix) 99 associations of public water service users (AUSPE) and 427 water point management committees (CGPE) set up\, run and trained in the management and maintenance of water points; (x) some 30 private operators supported and trained in the operation and maintenance of complex AEP networks; (xi) 50 artisanal borehole repairers trained and equipped with recovery equipment through pumping equipment contracts; and (xii) training\, facilitation and awareness-raising campaigns carried out in nearly 526 localities in the two subprogramme regions. The estimated pre-tax cost of the subprogramme is UA 34.069 million.,Le prsent sous-programme dalimentation en eau potable et dassainissement (AEPA) en milieu rural intervient dans lensemble des 11 dpartements des deux rgions concernes (Tillabry et Dosso). Ces provinces comptent parmi les plus pauvres du pays\, avec une forte proportion de la population 70% pour les deux rgions contre 60% en moyenne nationale\, en dessous du seuil de pauvret. Ce sous-programme\, tout en sinscrivant dans une dynamique de concertation permanente avec les principaux bailleurs du secteur de leau dans le pays\, constitue la seconde phase de lInitiative AEPA de la Banque en milieu rural au Niger. Dans le mme temps\, il constitue une entit  part entire du Programme National dEau Potable et dAssainissement en milieu rural du pays  lhorizon 2020 (PNAEPA). Les principales ralisations attendues du sous-programme au terme de la priode de 36 mois prvue pour sa ralisation\, sont : (i) 9881 nouvelles latrines individuelles pour les familles les plus vulnrables; (ii) 9881 bacs  laver et dispositifs de lavemains ; (iii) 295 nouvelles latrines multi-compartiments\, construites au niveau des infrastructures publiques villageoises (coles\, centres de sant et autres lieux publics); (iv) 99 ouvrages et rseaux dAEP; (v) 297 nouveaux forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine ; (vi) 130 forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine\, rhabilits ; (vii) 300 maons forms aux techniques de construction des latrines; (viii) 300 relais fminins et 150 matres dcoles forms sur les thmes de lhygine et de la prvention au niveau des villages; (ix) 99 associations des usagers du service public de leau (AUSPE) et 427 comits de gestion de points deau (CGPE) mis en place\, anims et forms  la gestion et  lentretien des points deau; (x) une trentaine doprateurs privs appuys et forms  lexploitation et  la maintenance de rseaux dAEP complexes; (xi) 50 artisans rparateurs de forages forms et dots en matriel de dpannage par le biais des contrats dquipements de pompage; et (xii) des campagnes de formation\, animation et sensibilisation ralises dans prs de 526 localits des deux rgions du sous-programme. Le cot estimatif hors taxe du sous-programme est de 34\,069 millions dUC.,Due to the nature of the works put in place\, the subprogramme will allow\, among other things: (i) improving the availability and quality of drinking water; (ii) reducing the difficulty of carrying water\, especially for women; (iii) reducing the cost of water; (iv) reducing the prevalence rate of waterborne diseases; and (v) promoting water-related income-generating activities. Indeed\, the community work approach recommended for the construction of family latrines will allow rural artisans to participate fully in the construction of the works.,De par la nature des ouvrages mis en place\, le sous-programme permettra entre autres : (i) lamlioration de la disponibilit et de la qualit de leau de consommation; (ii) la rduction de la pnibilit du portage de leau\, notamment pour les femmes; (iii) la rduction du cot de leau; (iv) la rduction du taux de prvalence des maladies dorigine hydrique; et (v) la promotion des activits gnratrices de revenus lies  leau. En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

title_narrative: Niger - National Rural Drinking Water Supply and Sanitation Programme (NRDWSSP) (Phase II: Second Sub-Programme - 2011-2014),Niger - Programme national dapprovisionnement en eau potable et dassainissement en milieu rural (PNAEPA) (Phase II : Deuxime sous-programme - 2011-2014)
description_narrative: The proposed rural drinking water supply and sanitation (WATSAN) subprogramme operates in all 11 departments of the two regions concerned (Tillabry and Dosso). These provinces are among the poorest in the country\, with a high proportion of the population of 70% for both regions compared to the national average of 60%\, below the poverty line. This sub-programme\, while part of a process of ongoing consultation with the main donors of the water sector in the country\, constitutes the second phase of the Bank's AEPA Initiative in rural Niger. At the same time\, it is a full-fledged entity of the country's National Rural Drinking Water and Sanitation Programme for 2020 (PNAEPA). The main expected accomplishments of the subprogramme at the end of the 36-month period foreseen for its implementation are: (i) 9881 new individual latrines for the most vulnerable families; (ii) 9881 washing bins and hand-washing facilities; (iii) 295 new multi-compartment latrines\, built in village public infrastructure (schools\, health centres and other public places); (iv) 99 water supply structures and networks; (v) 297 new boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps; (vi) 130 boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps\, rehabilitated; (vii) 300 masons trained in latrine construction techniques; (viii) 300 female relays and 150 school teachers trained in hygiene and prevention at the village level; (ix) 99 associations of public water service users (AUSPE) and 427 water point management committees (CGPE) set up\, run and trained in the management and maintenance of water points; (x) some 30 private operators supported and trained in the operation and maintenance of complex AEP networks; (xi) 50 artisanal borehole repairers trained and equipped with recovery equipment through pumping equipment contracts; and (xii) training\, facilitation and awareness-raising campaigns carried out in nearly 526 localities in the two subprogramme regions. The estimated pre-tax cost of the subprogramme is UA 34.069 million.,Le prsent sous-programme dalimentation en eau potable et dassainissement (AEPA) en milieu rural intervient dans lensemble des 11 dpartements des deux rgions concernes (Tillabry et Dosso). Ces provinces comptent parmi les plus pauvres du pays\, avec une forte proportion de la population 70% pour les deux rgions contre 60% en moyenne nationale\, en dessous du seuil de pauvret. Ce sous-programme\, tout en sinscrivant dans une dynamique de concertation permanente avec les principaux bailleurs du secteur de leau dans le pays\, constitue la seconde phase de lInitiative AEPA de la Banque en milieu rural au Niger. Dans le mme temps\, il constitue une entit  part entire du Programme National dEau Potable et dAssainissement en milieu rural du pays  lhorizon 2020 (PNAEPA). Les principales ralisations attendues du sous-programme au terme de la priode de 36 mois prvue pour sa ralisation\, sont : (i) 9881 nouvelles latrines individuelles pour les familles les plus vulnrables; (ii) 9881 bacs  laver et dispositifs de lavemains ; (iii) 295 nouvelles latrines multi-compartiments\, construites au niveau des infrastructures publiques villageoises (coles\, centres de sant et autres lieux publics); (iv) 99 ouvrages et rseaux dAEP; (v) 297 nouveaux forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine ; (vi) 130 forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine\, rhabilits ; (vii) 300 maons forms aux techniques de construction des latrines; (viii) 300 relais fminins et 150 matres dcoles forms sur les thmes de lhygine et de la prvention au niveau des villages; (ix) 99 associations des usagers du service public de leau (AUSPE) et 427 comits de gestion de points deau (CGPE) mis en place\, anims et forms  la gestion et  lentretien des points deau; (x) une trentaine doprateurs privs appuys et forms  lexploitation et  la maintenance de rseaux dAEP complexes; (xi) 50 artisans rparateurs de forages forms et dots en matriel de dpannage par le biais des contrats dquipements de pompage; et (xii) des campagnes de formation\, animation et sensibilisation ralises dans prs de 526 localits des deux rgions du sous-programme. Le cot estimatif hors taxe du sous-programme est de 34\,069 millions dUC.,Due to the nature of the works put in place\, the subprogramme will allow\, among other things: (i) improving the availability and quality of drinking water; (ii) reducing the difficulty of carrying water\, especially for women; (iii) reducing the cost of water; (iv) reducing the prevalence rate of waterborne diseases; and (v) promoting water-related income-generating activities. Indeed\, the community work approach recommended for the construction of family latrines will allow rural artisans to participate fully in the construction of the works.,De par la nature des ouvrages mis en place\, le sous-programme permettra entre autres : (i) lamlioration de la disponibilit et de la qualit de leau de consommation; (ii) la rduction de la pnibilit du portage de leau\, notamment pour les femmes; (iii) la rduction du cot de leau; (iv) la rduction du taux de prvalence des maladies dorigine hydrique; et (v) la promotion des activits gnratrices de revenus lies  leau. En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.
participating_org_narrative: African Development Fund,Rural Water Supply & Sanitation,Government Of Niger,MINISTERE EN CHARGE DE L EAU

En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

description_narrative: The proposed rural drinking water supply and sanitation (WATSAN) subprogramme operates in all 11 departments of the two regions concerned (Tillabry and Dosso). These provinces are among the poorest in the country\, with a high proportion of the population of 70% for both regions compared to the national average of 60%\, below the poverty line. This sub-programme\, while part of a process of ongoing consultation with the main donors of the water sector in the country\, constitutes the second phase of the Bank's AEPA Initiative in rural Niger. At the same time\, it is a full-fledged entity of the country's National Rural Drinking Water and Sanitation Programme for 2020 (PNAEPA). The main expected accomplishments of the subprogramme at the end of the 36-month period foreseen for its implementation are: (i) 9881 new individual latrines for the most vulnerable families; (ii) 9881 washing bins and hand-washing facilities; (iii) 295 new multi-compartment latrines\, built in village public infrastructure (schools\, health centres and other public places); (iv) 99 water supply structures and networks; (v) 297 new boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps; (vi) 130 boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps\, rehabilitated; (vii) 300 masons trained in latrine construction techniques; (viii) 300 female relays and 150 school teachers trained in hygiene and prevention at the village level; (ix) 99 associations of public water service users (AUSPE) and 427 water point management committees (CGPE) set up\, run and trained in the management and maintenance of water points; (x) some 30 private operators supported and trained in the operation and maintenance of complex AEP networks; (xi) 50 artisanal borehole repairers trained and equipped with recovery equipment through pumping equipment contracts; and (xii) training\, facilitation and awareness-raising campaigns carried out in nearly 526 localities in the two subprogramme regions. En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

Les principales ralisations attendues du sous-programme au terme de la priode de 36 mois prvue pour sa ralisation\, sont : (i) 9881 nouvelles latrines individuelles pour les familles les plus vulnrables; (ii) 9881 bacs  laver et dispositifs de lavemains ; (iii) 295 nouvelles latrines multi-compartiments\, construites au niveau des infrastructures publiques villageoises (coles\, centres de sant et autres lieux publics); (iv) 99 ouvrages et rseaux dAEP; (v) 297 nouveaux forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine ; (vi) 130 forages quips de pompes  motricit humaine\, rhabilits ; (vii) 300 maons forms aux techniques de construction des latrines; (viii) 300 relais fminins et 150 matres dcoles forms sur les thmes de lhygine et de la prvention au niveau des villages; (ix) 99 associations des usagers du service public de leau (AUSPE) et 427 comits de gestion de points deau (CGPE) mis en place\, anims et forms  la gestion et  lentretien des points deau; (x) une trentaine doprateurs privs appuys et forms  lexploitation et  la maintenance de rseaux dAEP complexes; (xi) 50 artisans rparateurs de forages forms et dots en matriel de dpannage par le biais des contrats dquipements de pompage; et (xii) des campagnes de formation\, animation et sensibilisation ralises dans prs de 526 localits des deux rgions du sous-programme. Le cot estimatif hors taxe du sous-programme est de 34\,069 millions dUC.,Due to the nature of the works put in place\, the subprogramme will allow\, among other things: (i) improving the availability and quality of drinking water; (ii) reducing the difficulty of carrying water\, especially for women; (iii) reducing the cost of water; (iv) reducing the prevalence rate of waterborne diseases; and (v) promoting water-related income-generating activities. Indeed\, the community work approach recommended for the construction of family latrines will allow rural artisans to participate fully in the construction of the works.,De par la nature des ouvrages mis en place\, le sous-programme permettra entre autres : (i) lamlioration de la disponibilit et de la qualit de leau de consommation; (ii) la rduction de la pnibilit du portage de leau\, notamment pour les femmes; (iii) la rduction du cot de leau; (iv) la rduction du taux de prvalence des maladies dorigine hydrique; et (v) la promotion des activits gnratrices de revenus lies  leau. En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

title_narrative: Niger - National Rural Drinking Water Supply and Sanitation Programme (NRDWSSP) (Phase II: Second Sub-Programme - 2011-2014),Niger - Programme national dapprovisionnement en eau potable et dassainissement en milieu rural (PNAEPA) (Phase II : Deuxime sous-programme - 2011-2014)
description_narrative: The proposed rural drinking water supply and sanitation (WATSAN) subprogramme operates in all 11 departments of the two regions concerned (Tillabry and Dosso). These provinces are among the poorest in the country\, with a high proportion of the population of 70% for both regions compared to the national average of 60%\, below the poverty line. This sub-programme\, while part of a process of ongoing consultation with the main donors of the water sector in the country\, constitutes the second phase of the Bank's AEPA Initiative in rural Niger. At the same time\, it is a full-fledged entity of the country's National Rural Drinking Water and Sanitation Programme for 2020 (PNAEPA). The main expected accomplishments of the subprogramme at the end of the 36-month period foreseen for its implementation are: (i) 9881 new individual latrines for the most vulnerable families; (ii) 9881 washing bins and hand-washing facilities; (iii) 295 new multi-compartment latrines\, built in village public infrastructure (schools\, health centres and other public places); (iv) 99 water supply structures and networks; (v) 297 new boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps; (vi) 130 boreholes equipped with human-powered pumps\, rehabilitated; (vii) 300 masons trained in latrine construction techniques; (viii) 300 female relays and 150 school teachers trained in hygiene and prevention at the village level; (ix) 99 associations of public water service users (AUSPE) and 427 water point management committees (CGPE) set up\, run and trained in the management and maintenance of water points; (x) some 30 private operators supported and trained in the operation and maintenance of complex AEP networks; (xi) 50 artisanal borehole repairers trained and equipped with recovery equipment through pumping equipment contracts; and (xii) training\, facilitation and awareness-raising campaigns carried out in nearly 526 localities in the two subprogramme regions. Ces provinces comptent parmi les plus pauvres du pays\, avec une forte proportion de la population 70% pour les deux rgions contre 60% en moyenne nationale\, en dessous du seuil de pauvret. Ce sous-programme\, tout en sinscrivant dans une dynamique de concertation permanente avec les principaux bailleurs du secteur de leau dans le pays\, constitue la seconde phase de lInitiative AEPA de la Banque en milieu rural au Niger. Dans le mme temps\, il constitue une entit  part entire du Programme National dEau Potable et dAssainissement en milieu rural du pays  lhorizon 2020 (PNAEPA). Le cot estimatif hors taxe du sous-programme est de 34\,069 millions dUC.,Due to the nature of the works put in place\, the subprogramme will allow\, among other things: (i) improving the availability and quality of drinking water; (ii) reducing the difficulty of carrying water\, especially for women; (iii) reducing the cost of water; (iv) reducing the prevalence rate of waterborne diseases; and (v) promoting water-related income-generating activities. Indeed\, the community work approach recommended for the construction of family latrines will allow rural artisans to participate fully in the construction of the works.,De par la nature des ouvrages mis en place\, le sous-programme permettra entre autres : (i) lamlioration de la disponibilit et de la qualit de leau de consommation; (ii) la rduction de la pnibilit du portage de leau\, notamment pour les femmes; (iii) la rduction du cot de leau; (iv) la rduction du taux de prvalence des maladies dorigine hydrique; et (v) la promotion des activits gnratrices de revenus lies  leau. En effet\, lapproche des travaux communautaires prconise pour la construction des latrines familiales\, permettra aux artisans ruraux de participer pleinement  la mise en place des ouvrages.,The beneficiaries of the subprogramme are the rural populations of the 11 departments of the two regions (Tillabry and Dosso)\, representing a total of 4.293 million inhabitants out of the country's 15 million.,Les bnficiaires du sous-programme sont les populations rurales des 11 dpartements des deux rgions (Tillabry et Dosso)\, soit 4\, 293 millions dhabitants au total sur les 15 millions que compte le pays.

title_narrative: Niger - Rural Water supply Programme Study,Niger - Etude dun programme dhydraulique rurale au Niger
description_narrative: The proposed study is among the Governments priorities in economic and social development in Niger.  The study will give details on the Water Resources Development Master Plan (SDMVRE) on the basis of a more thorough resources and requirements assessment.  It should lead to the creation of a mechanism permitting decentralised planning (by basin\, by region\, department and commune) of PWSS actions according to a participatory approach and a well determined programming cycle. The study will be conducted in two phases in the rural areas of Niger over a total of fourteen (14) months\, including two one month periods each to review and approve reports by the Administration of Niger and the ADF as well as to ensure their finalisation by the consultant. The total cost is estimated at UA 0.98 million. Conducting the study will contribute to achieving the objective of supplying potable water and providing access to adequate sanitation infrastructure objective in rural areas by the year 2010\, owing to better awareness of the sectors needs and sound preparation of projects and programmes.,Ltude propose figure parmi les priorits du Gouvernement en matire de dveloppement conomique et social au Niger. Sa mise en uvre permettra de dtailler le Schma Directeur de Mise en Valeur des Ressources en Eau (SDMVRE) sur la base dune valuation plus fine des ressources et des besoins. Elle devrait aboutir  la mise en place dun mcanisme permettant la planification dcentralise (par bassin\, par rgion\, dpartement et commune) des actions dAEPA selon une approche participative et un cycle de programmation bien tabli. Ltude se droulera dans les zones rurales du Niger et sera excute en deux phases successives sur une dure totale de quatorze (14) mois y compris deux priodes dun mois chacune pour lexamen et lapprobation des rapports par lAdministration nigrienne et le FAD ainsi que la finalisation de ceux-ci par le consultant. Le cot total est estim  0\,98 million dUC. Lexcution de ltude contribuera  la ralisation de lobjectif dapprovisionnement en eau potable et daccs aux infrastructures dassainissement adquat des zones rurales  lhorizon 2010\, grce  une meilleure connaissance des besoins dans le secteur et une bonne prparation des projets et programmes.,The sectoral objective of the envisaged study is to contribute to the improvement of the rural population of Nigers access to potable water and appropriate sanitation systems. The specific objective is to determine the feasibility of potable water supply and sanitation operational programmes for Nigers rural areas.,Ltude a pour objectif sectoriel de contribuer  lamlioration de laccs des populations des zones rurales du Niger  leau potable et aux systmes appropris dassainissement. De faon spcifique\,  il sagit de llaboration au niveau de la faisabilit\, de programmes oprationnels dapprovisionnement en eau potable et dassainissement des zones rurales du Niger.,The main beneficiaries are the government as well as the rural populations of Niger\, whose living conditions should be improved following the implementation of the high priority actions identified in this study.,Les principaux bnficiaires sont le gouvernement ainsi que les populations rurales du Niger dont les conditions de vies devraient tre amliores  la suite de la mise en uvre des actions hautement prioritaires identifies dans le cadre de la prsente tude.
participating_org_narrative: African Development Fund,Government Of Niger,MINISTERE DE L'AGRICULRURE ET DE  L'ENVIRONNEMENT DIRECTION DE L'AMENAGEMENT

title_narrative: SONICHAR ADDUCTION D'EAU,Projet Sonichar d'adduction d'eau
description_narrative: ISSUE: The construction contract was awarded in June 1986\, with a completion period of 24 months and supervision was awarded on 5th March 1986. The work physically commenced on 1st September 1986. The contractor was suspended in 1989 in order to allow Government investigation of the course of the failed sections of the road. The contract was eventually terminated. The project remains nearly 60% completed with UA 13.44 million disbursed. There have not been any disbursements since 9th March 1989. The Government has confirmed that the dispute between the Government and Messrs. ABU and Partners has been resolved with no legal or financial obligations to the Bank. On 18th December 1997\, the Government requested Bank's approval to revise the list of works and services with a view to completing the project by utilizing the remaining UA 10.23 million. The Bank approved the Government's request on 19th April 1999\, with the revised deadline for final disbursement being 31st December 2002. Since the approval of the revised list of works and services\, the Government has entered into contract with a consulting firm for the design review\, pre-tender activities and supervision of works. The draft tender documents are currently being reviewed by the Bank. However\, the pre-qualifying contractors is completed. However\, the Government has been very slow in implementing the project. ACTION: The Government should speed up the procurement process. The Bank's mission that is scheduled for early March will conclude the review of the tender Documents with the Government.
participating_org_narrative: African Development Bank,MINISTERE DU PLAN,MINISTERE DU PLAN

On 18th December 1997\, the Government requested Bank's approval to revise the list of works and services with a view to completing the project by utilizing the remaining UA 10.23 million. The Bank approved the Government's request on 19th April 1999\, with the revised deadline for final disbursement being 31st December 2002. Since the approval of the revised list of works and services\, the Government has entered into contract with a consulting firm for the design review\, pre-tender activities and supervision of works. The draft tender documents are currently being reviewed by the Bank. However\, the pre-qualifying contractors is completed. However\, the Government has been very slow in implementing the project. ACTION: The Government should speed up the procurement process. The Bank's mission that is scheduled for early March will conclude the review of the tender Documents with the Government.
participating_org_narrative: African Development Bank,MINISTERE DU PLAN,MINISTERE DU PLAN
sector: Water sector policy and administrative management
sector_narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management
transaction_description_narrative: Total Interest Repayment till end of 2009

title_narrative: PROJET D'AEPA EN MILIEU RURAL DANS LES REGIONS DE MARADI\,TAHOUA ET TILLABERI,Projet d'approvisionnement en eau potable et assainissement en Milieu Rural dans les Rgions de Maradi\,Tahoua et Tillaberi
description_narrative: Le Projet dapprovisionnement en eau potable et dassainissement en milieu rural dans les rgions de Maradi\, Tahoua et Tillabri a t identifi et prpar  partir de ltude dun programme dhydraulique rurale\, ralise en 2004 par un bureau dtudes\, sur un financement de la Banque. Il sinscrit dans le cadre de lInitiative de la Banque pour leau et lassainissement en milieu rural et\, de par sa conception\, se situe dj dans le cadre dune approche programmatique en sappuyant sur les structures prennes existantes. Le choix des zones dintervention du projet se justifie dabord par le faible accs des populations aux services d'eau potable et d'assainissement dans les rgions de Tahoua\, Tillabri et Maradi. En effet\, le taux d'accs dans ces trois rgions (56%\, 45% et 47%) est infrieur  la moyenne nationale qui est de 59%. En outre\, ces rgions prsentent lindice de pauvret le plus lev du pays. Sa ralisation permettra de contribuer  la satisfaction des besoins en infrastructures deau et dassainissement pour environ 800.000 personnes dont 146.000 directement concerns par leau potable\, 86.000 par lassainissement familial (environ 14.300 mnages) et la totalit de la population par les ouvrages dassainissement public. Globalement le projet contribuera  faire passer le taux daccs  leau potable de 56%\, 45% et 47% respectivement  Maradi\, Tahoua et Tillabri  65% en 2009. Il contribuera  hauteur de 2 %  la ralisation des Objectifs du Millnaire pour le Dveloppement en matire deau potable milieu rural. En matire dassainissement\, sa contribution  la ralisation des OMD est estime  0\,4 %.,Le projet a pour but de contribuer  lamlioration des conditions socio-conomiques et sanitaires des populations rurales. Spcifiquement\, il a pour objectif de i) amliorer laccs au service dalimentation en eau potable et dassainissement familial et public\, dans 3 rgions (Maradi Tahoua et Tillabri) ; et ii) contribuer au renforcement du pouvoir de gestion de femmes dans le secteur de leau et d lassainissement.,Dans lensemble\, les actions du projet toucheront environ 800.000 personnes dans 280 villages parmi les 2507 constituant les trois rgions. Parmi cette population\, 146.000 individus seront directement concerns par leau potable\, 86.000 par lassainissement familial (environ 14.300 mnages) et la totalit par les ouvrages dassainissement public.
participating_org_narrative: African Development Fund,Rural Water Supply & Sanitation,Government Of Niger,MINISTERE EN CHARGE DE L EAU
sector: Water sector policy and administrative management
sector_narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management
transaction_description_narrative: Total Disbursement in Fourth Quarter of 2010

Le choix des zones dintervention du projet se justifie dabord par le faible accs des populations aux services d'eau potable et d'assainissement dans les rgions de Tahoua\, Tillabri et Maradi. En effet\, le taux d'accs dans ces trois rgions (56%\, 45% et 47%) est infrieur  la moyenne nationale qui est de 59%. En outre\, ces rgions prsentent lindice de pauvret le plus lev du pays. Sa ralisation permettra de contribuer  la satisfaction des besoins en infrastructures deau et dassainissement pour environ 800.000 personnes dont 146.000 directement concerns par leau potable\, 86.000 par lassainissement familial (environ 14.300 mnages) et la totalit de la population par les ouvrages dassainissement public. Globalement le projet contribuera  faire passer le taux daccs  leau potable de 56%\, 45% et 47% respectivement  Maradi\, Tahoua et Tillabri  65% en 2009. Il contribuera  hauteur de 2 %  la ralisation des Objectifs du Millnaire pour le Dveloppement en matire deau potable milieu rural. En matire dassainissement\, sa contribution  la ralisation des OMD est estime  0\,4 %.,Le projet a pour but de contribuer  lamlioration des conditions socio-conomiques et sanitaires des populations rurales. Spcifiquement\, il a pour objectif de i) amliorer laccs au service dalimentation en eau potable et dassainissement familial et public\, dans 3 rgions (Maradi Tahoua et Tillabri) ; et ii) contribuer au renforcement du pouvoir de gestion de femmes dans le secteur de leau et d lassainissement.,Dans lensemble\, les actions du projet toucheront environ 800.000 personnes dans 280 villages parmi les 2507 constituant les trois rgions. Parmi cette population\, 146.000 individus seront directement concerns par leau potable\, 86.000 par lassainissement familial (environ 14.300 mnages) et la totalit par les ouvrages dassainissement public.
participating_org_narrative: African Development Fund,Rural Water Supply & Sanitation,Government Of Niger,MINISTERE EN CHARGE DE L EAU
sector: Water sector policy and administrative management
sector_narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management
transaction_description_narrative: Total Disbursement in Second Quarter of 2012

Il contribuera  hauteur de 2 %  la ralisation des Objectifs du Millnaire pour le Dveloppement en matire deau potable milieu rural. En matire dassainissement\, sa contribution  la ralisation des OMD est estime  0\,4 %.,Le projet a pour but de contribuer  lamlioration des conditions socio-conomiques et sanitaires des populations rurales. Spcifiquement\, il a pour objectif de i) amliorer laccs au service dalimentation en eau potable et dassainissement familial et public\, dans 3 rgions (Maradi Tahoua et Tillabri) ; et ii) contribuer au renforcement du pouvoir de gestion de femmes dans le secteur de leau et d lassainissement.,Dans lensemble\, les actions du projet toucheront environ 800.000 personnes dans 280 villages parmi les 2507 constituant les trois rgions. Parmi cette population\, 146.000 individus seront directement concerns par leau potable\, 86.000 par lassainissement familial (environ 14.300 mnages) et la totalit par les ouvrages dassainissement public.

description_narrative: Le Projet dapprovisionnement en eau potable et dassainissement en milieu rural dans les rgions de Maradi\, Tahoua et Tillabri a t identifi et prpar  partir de ltude dun programme dhydraulique rurale\, ralise en 2004 par un bureau dtudes\, sur un financement de la Banque. Il sinscrit dans le cadre de lInitiative de la Banque pour leau et lassainissement en milieu rural et\, de par sa conception\, se situe dj dans le cadre dune approche programmatique en sappuyant sur les structures prennes existantes. Le choix des zones dintervention du projet se justifie dabord par le faible accs des populations aux services d'eau potable et d'assainissement dans les rgions de Tahoua\, Tillabri et Maradi. En effet\, le taux d'accs dans ces trois rgions (56%\, 45% et 47%) est infrieur  la moyenne nationale qui est de 59%. En outre\, ces rgions prsentent lindice de pauvret le plus lev du pays. sector: Water sector policy and administrative management
sector_narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management
transaction_description_narrative: Total Disbursement in Third Quarter of 2010

title_narrative: Niger - Development and Implementation of the National Action Plan for Integrated Water Resources Management (PANGIRE),Niger - laboration et mise en uvre du Plan dAction de la Gestion Intgre des Ressources en Eau (PANGIRE)
description_narrative: The project for the Development and Implementation of the National Action Plan for Integrated Water Resources Management (PANGIRE) of Niger is consistent with the African Water Vision 2025\, including managing water resources\, meeting urgent needs and strengthening basic investments. The PANGIRE preparation and implementation aim to strengthen the water resources management framework across Niger. The purpose of this intervention is to support the Nigerian Government in its reform implementation\, which established the GIRE approach as the basis for public sanitation in the water and sanitation sector. The proposed intervention\, within the framework of this project\, is divided into two components: improving the planning and management framework of water resources through the GIRE Action Plan which will be supported by the Priority Investment Programme (PIP) in the medium and long term. The project is planned for 30 months.,Le projet dlaboration et de mise en uvre du Plan daction national de gestion intgre et dutilisation rationnelle des ressources en eau (PANGIRE) au Niger sinscrit dans la vision africaine de leau  lhorizon 2025 y compris lamlioration de la gestion des ressources en eau\, la satisfaction des besoins urgents en eau et le renforcement des investissements de base. La prparation et la mise en uvre du PANGIRE\, objet du prsent appui a pour but de renforcer le cadre de gestion des ressources en eau au Niger. Cette opration vise  appuyer le Gouvernement Nigrien dans le cadre de l'application de sa rforme qui consacre lapproche de GIRE comme fondement de laction publique dans le secteur de leau et de lassainissement. L'intervention propose\, dans le cadre du prsent appui\, se dcline en deux composantes: lamlioration du cadre de planification et la gestion des ressources  travers le Plan daction GIRE qui sera accompagne par le dveloppement de Programmes dinvestissements prioritaires (PIP)\,  moyen et  long terme. Le projet a une dure de 30 mois.,The PANGIREs preparation and  implementation overall objective  is to promote socio-economic development\, reduce poverty\, preserve the environment and improve human and natural system resilience to climate change.,Lobjectif global de la prparation du PANGIRE et de sa mise en uvre est la promotion du dveloppement socio-conomique\, la lutte contre la pauvret\, la prservation de lenvironnement et lamlioration de la rsilience des systmes humains et des systmes naturels au changement climatique.,The projects ultimate beneficiaries are the populations of Niger as primary users of water and the environment through sustainable management and rational use of water resources. Other direct beneficiaries or key players include: The State\, Ministries Public administrative services (central and devolved services)\, Water Management Units (WMUs)\, the National Water and Sanitation Commission (CNEA) and its regional branches (CREA)\, public water supply (SPEN et SEEN) and sanitation services\, Research and Knowledge Development Institutions\, the private sector (consultants\, hydraulic engineering firms\, etc.)\, the National Water Partnership (NEP)\, NGOs and water users associations\, local authorities\, Basin agencies (NBA\, LCBC)\, regional and subregional organizations (ECOWAS\, WAEMU et CILSS)\, and technical and financial partners.,Les bnficiaires ultimes du projet sont les populations du Niger en tant quusagers de leau et lenvironnement  travers la gestion durable et lutilisation rationnelle des ressources en eau. Les autres bnficiaires directs ou acteurs incluent : lEtat : les administrations publiques des ministres (services centraux et dconcentrs); les Units de gestion de l'eau (UGE) ; la Commission nationale de leau et lassainissement (CNEA) et ses commissions rgionales (CREA) ; les services publics dalimentation en eau potable (SPEN et SEEN) et dassainissement ; les institutions de recherche et de dveloppement des connaissances ; le secteur priv (consultants\, entreprises de travaux hydrauliques\, ) ; le Partenariat national de leau (PNE)\, les ONGs et Associations des usagers de leau (AUE); les collectivits territoriales ; les organismes des bassins (ABN\, CBLT) ; les organisations rgionales et sous-rgionales (CEDEAO\, UEMOA\, CILSS) ; les Partenaires techniques et financiers.
participating_org_narrative: AfricaWater Facility Fund,Ministre de lhydraulique et de lassainissement (MHA),MINISTERE EN CHARGE DE L EAU
sector: Water sector policy and administrative management
sector_narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management
transaction_description_narrative: Total Disbursement in August of 2018

Other direct beneficiaries or key players include: The State\, Ministries Public administrative services (central and devolved services)\, Water Management Units (WMUs)\, the National Water and Sanitation Commission (CNEA) and its regional branches (CREA)\, public water supply (SPEN et SEEN) and sanitation services\, Research and Knowledge Development Institutions\, the private sector (consultants\, hydraulic engineering firms\, etc.)\, the National Water Partnership (NEP)\, NGOs and water users associations\, local authorities\, Basin agencies (NBA\, LCBC)\, regional and subregional organizations (ECOWAS\, WAEMU et CILSS)\, and technical and financial partners.,Les bnficiaires ultimes du projet sont les populations du Niger en tant quusagers de leau et lenvironnement  travers la gestion durable et lutilisation rationnelle des ressources en eau. Les autres bnficiaires directs ou acteurs incluent : lEtat : les administrations publiques des ministres (services centraux et dconcentrs); les Units de gestion de l'eau (UGE) ; la Commission nationale de leau et lassainissement (CNEA) et ses commissions rgionales (CREA) ; les services publics dalimentation en eau potable (SPEN et SEEN) et dassainissement ; les institutions de recherche et de dveloppement des connaissances ; le secteur priv (consultants\, entreprises de travaux hydrauliques\, ) ; le Partenariat national de leau (PNE)\, les ONGs et Associations des usagers de leau (AUE); les collectivits territoriales ; les organismes des bassins (ABN\, CBLT) ; les organisations rgionales et sous-rgionales (CEDEAO\, UEMOA\, CILSS) ; les Partenaires techniques et financiers.

title_narrative: Niger - Development and Implementation of the National Action Plan for Integrated Water Resources Management (PANGIRE),Niger - laboration et mise en uvre du Plan dAction de la Gestion Intgre des Ressources en Eau (PANGIRE)
description_narrative: The project for the Development and Implementation of the National Action Plan for Integrated Water Resources Management (PANGIRE) of Niger is consistent with the African Water Vision 2025\, including managing water resources\, meeting urgent needs and strengthening basic investments. The PANGIRE preparation and implementation aim to strengthen the water resources management framework across Niger. The purpose of this intervention is to support the Nigerian Government in its reform implementation\, which established the GIRE approach as the basis for public sanitation in the water and sanitation sector. The proposed intervention\, within the framework of this project\, is divided into two components: improving the planning and management framework of water resources through the GIRE Action Plan which will be supported by the Priority Investment Programme (PIP) in the medium and long term. The project is planned for 30 months.,Le projet dlaboration et de mise en uvre du Plan daction national de gestion intgre et dutilisation rationnelle des ressources en eau (PANGIRE) au Niger sinscrit dans la vision africaine de leau  lhorizon 2025 y compris lamlioration de la gestion des ressources en eau\, la satisfaction des besoins urgents en eau et le renforcement des investissements de base. La prparation et la mise en uvre du PANGIRE\, objet du prsent appui a pour but de renforcer le cadre de gestion des ressources en eau au Niger. Cette opration vise  appuyer le Gouvernement Nigrien dans le cadre de l'application de sa rforme qui consacre lapproche de GIRE comme fondement de laction publique dans le secteur de leau et de lassainissement. L'intervention propose\, dans le cadre du prsent appui\, se dcline en deux composantes: lamlioration du cadre de planification et la gestion des ressources  travers le Plan daction GIRE qui sera accompagne par le dveloppement de Programmes dinvestissements prioritaires (PIP)\,  moyen et  long terme. Le projet a une dure de 30 mois.,The PANGIREs preparation and  implementation overall objective  is to promote socio-economic development\, reduce poverty\, preserve the environment and improve human and natural system resilience to climate change.,Lobjectif global de la prparation du PANGIRE et de sa mise en uvre est la promotion du dveloppement socio-conomique\, la lutte contre la pauvret\, la prservation de lenvironnement et lamlioration de la rsilience des systmes humains et des systmes naturels au changement climatique.,The projects ultimate beneficiaries are the populations of Niger as primary users of water and the environment through sustainable management and rational use of water resources. Other direct beneficiaries or key players include: The State\, Ministries Public administrative services (central and devolved services)\, Water Management Units (WMUs)\, the National Water and Sanitation Commission (CNEA) and its regional branches (CREA)\, public water supply (SPEN et SEEN) and sanitation services\, Research and Knowledge Development Institutions\, the private sector (consultants\, hydraulic engineering firms\, etc.)\, the National Water Partnership (NEP)\, NGOs and water users associations\, local authorities\, Basin agencies (NBA\, LCBC)\, regional and subregional organizations (ECOWAS\, WAEMU et CILSS)\, and technical and financial partners.,Les bnficiaires ultimes du projet sont les populations du Niger en tant quusagers de leau et lenvironnement  travers la gestion durable et lutilisation rationnelle des ressources en eau. Les autres bnficiaires directs ou acteurs incluent : lEtat : les administrations publiques des ministres (services centraux et dconcentrs); les Units de gestion de l'eau (UGE) ; la Commission nationale de leau et lassainissement (CNEA) et ses commissions rgionales (CREA) ; les services publics dalimentation en eau potable (SPEN et SEEN) et dassainissement ; les institutions de recherche et de dveloppement des connaissances ; le secteur priv (consultants\, entreprises de travaux hydrauliques\, ) ; le Partenariat national de leau (PNE)\, les ONGs et Associations des usagers de leau (AUE); les collectivits territoriales ; les organismes des bassins (ABN\, CBLT) ; les organisations rgionales et sous-rgionales (CEDEAO\, UEMOA\, CILSS) ; les Partenaires techniques et financiers.

title_narrative: SWaSSA: Regional Water and Sanitation- AWF and WSP
description_narrative: Funding under this initiative provides support for two regional water and sanitation programs: the African Water Facility (AWF) and the World Bank Water and Sanitation Program in Africa (WSP). The AWF is a multi-donor trust fund established at the request of the African Ministers Council on Water (AMCOW) in May 2004\, and hosted by the African Development Bank. Current activities of the AWF cover four broad categories: strengthening water governance; investments to meet water needs; strengthening the financial base; and improving water knowledge and dissemination. The WSP aims to assist African Government's develop their capacity to implement large-scale water supply and sanitation programs.  Key objectives of this initiative are to: assist focus countries develop and implement large scale town Water Supply and Sanitation (WSS) programs\, and initiate improved approaches; and deepen the knowledge and experience of WSS management through an innovative and regional advocacy and learning pr
participating_org_narrative: Name Withheld,AUSTRALIA,Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

title_narrative: SWaSSA: Regional Water and Sanitation- AWF and WSP
description_narrative: Funding under this initiative provides support for two regional water and sanitation programs: the African Water Facility (AWF) and the World Bank Water and Sanitation Program in Africa (WSP). The AWF is a multi-donor trust fund established at the request of the African Ministers Council on Water (AMCOW) in May 2004\, and hosted by the African Development Bank. Current activities of the AWF cover four broad categories: strengthening water governance; investments to meet water needs; strengthening the financial base; and improving water knowledge and dissemination. The WSP aims to assist African Government's develop their capacity to implement large-scale water supply and sanitation programs.  Key objectives of this initiative are to: assist focus countries develop and implement large scale town Water Supply and Sanitation (WSS) programs\, and initiate improved approaches; and deepen the knowledge and experience of WSS management through an innovative and regional advocacy and learning pr

reporting_org_narrative: Foreign Affairs\, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD),Affaires trangres\, Commerce et Dveloppement Canada (MAECD)
title_narrative: Climate Change Adaptation Facility,Mcanisme pour ladaptation au changement climatique
description_narrative: The goal of this Facility is to help least developed countries increase their resilience to the effects of climate change. The Facility supports activities both within specific countries and at the global level.  Within individual countries\, the Facility helps the poor and vulnerable people improve food security by helping smallholder farmers adapt their farming practices so that they can maintain or increase the amount of food they produce. It supports building and improving local infrastructure\, such as rainwater collection and storage facilities\, irritation systems\, structures to prevent erosion\, and food storage facilities. It helps families\, especially women\, adopt new income-earning activities that are less vulnerable to the adverse effects of climate change. Finally\, the project provides training and assistance for local governments\, to help them address climate change in their development policies and programs.  On a global level\, the Facility facilitates the sharing of lessons learned and best practices to inform policies on climate change and sustainable development at national and global levels.,Ce mcanisme vise  aider les pays en dveloppement  tre mieux  mme de faire face aux effets des changements climatiques. Ce mcanisme finance des activits aussi bien  lchelon de certains pays qu lchelon mondial.   lchelon des pays\, le mcanisme aide les personnes pauvres et vulnrables  amliorer leur scurit alimentaire en aidant les petits exploitants agricoles  adapter leurs pratiques agricoles de faon  maintenir ou  accrotre leur production. Le mcanisme appuie la construction et lamlioration des infrastructures locales (comme des installations pour rcuprer de leau de pluie\, des installations dentreposage\, des systmes dirrigation\, des structures pour prvenir lrosion ou des installations dentreposage de la nourriture). Le mcanisme aide les familles\, et particulirement les femmes\,  se lancer dans de nouvelles activits rmunratrices qui sont moins vulnrables aux effets nfastes des changements climatiques. Le mcanisme offre galement de la formation et un appui aux administrations locales\, pour les aider  tenir compte des changements climatiques au moment dlaborer leurs politiques et leurs programmes.   lchelon mondial\, le mcanisme facilite la diffusion des leons tires et des pratiques exemplaires\, de faon  clairer les politiques sur les changements climatiques et le dveloppement durable  lchelon global et au niveau des pays.

description_narrative: Le programme renforcera les capacits des diffrents acteurs parties prenantes pour quils soient  terme capables de porter eux-mmes et de faon durable le dispositif et les investissements raliss. Il tablira des mcanismes de financement des infrastructures bass sur lexprience de la DDC au Niger (notamment le Fonds de Soutien aux Investissements Locaux\, FSILs) et prparera les communes  la mise en place ventuelle dun dispositif national dinvestissement (lAgence Nationale pour lInvestissement des Collectivits Territoriales attendue dici 2012) auquel la DDC pourrait envisager de contribuer une fois oprationnel. Le programme travaillera en coordination avec le Programme dAppui au Secteur de lElevage (PASEL) pour soutenir la mise en uvre de la stratgie dintervention nationale en matire dhydraulique pastorale (en prparation) dans les rgions de Maradi et Dosso.

title_narrative: Independent Process Monitoring and Evaluation(IPME) of the DFID contribution to the UNICEF Programme  Accelerating Sanitation and Water for All (SWA) in Neglected\, Off-Track Countries
description_narrative:
Accelerating Sanitation and Water for All in Off Track Countries is a multi-country water\, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) project supported by the Department for international Development (DFID). 
The projects focus includes WASH interventions in up to 12 countries in Africa\, South Asia and South East Asia that are not on-track to meet the Millennium Development Goal WASH Target 7c. The following nine countries have been selected by DFID and UNICEF\, DFIDs implementing partner\, to participate in the project: Bangladesh; Cambodia; Madagascar; Myanmar; Nepal; Niger; Pakistan; South Sudan; and Yemen
The aims and objectives of IPME are two-fold. 
First\, it will assess programme results and performance\, and formulate recommendations to allow programme improvements to be made in real time. 
Second\, it will design/develop/implement a robust impact and process evaluation framework to address key questions for the design/implementation of ASWA/ future WASH programmes.
participating_org_narrative: UK Department for International Development,United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF)
sector: Water sector policy and administrative management
transaction_description_narrative: TOTAL CONTRACT VALUE

title_narrative: Expert in hydrology\, morphology\, sediment transport DRR-Team Niger
description_narrative: This project concerns the deployment of DRR-Team\, following the formal request by the Ministre de l'Agriculture et de l'Elevage of Niger. The request is related to the alarming low water flow in the Middle part of the Niger River. The low flow results in critical conditions for drinking water availability for the population and pressure on the crop yields due to lack of irrigation water. DRR-Team is asked to assist the Ministre de l'Agriculture et de l'Elevage of Niger  and the Niger Basin Authority with technical expertise and advice for water distribution management.
participating_org_narrative: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,Havinga River Dynamics,Netherlands Enterprise Agency
sector: Water sector policy and administrative management

title_narrative: UNDP Water & Oceans Governance Programme 2014-2020,UNDP Water & Oceans Governance Programme 2014-2020
description_narrative:
Denna beredning avser ett std till UNDPs Strategi fr Water & Oceans Governance Programme (WOGP) 2014-17. Totalt avtalsbelopp med Sida fr perioden r 121 miljoner kronor och hela strategin r p 148 miljoner USD (1 milijard kronor) inklusive andra givares\, frmst GEFs std\, men exclusive regeringars medfinansiering .
Verksamheternas fokus ligger fortsatt p stdjandet av vattensektorreformer och strkandet av sektorfrvaltning (governance) vad gller vattenresursfrvaltning\, dricksvattenfrsrjning\, sanitet samt hygien genom etablerade mekanismer\, kanaler och program ssom WGF\, GoAL-WaSH och Shared Waters Partnership. 
Sidas bedmning r att planerade verksamheter och aktiviteter kommer att kunna genomfras som planerat och i enlighet med uppsatta ml och frvntade resultat i UNDPs strategi. 
Den valda finansieringsformen r ett icke-ronmrkt programbaserat (PBA) gvobistnd. Koordinering sker dels genom ett rligt mte samt i direkt dialog med UNDP. Uppfljning kommer\, frutom genom rsgenomgngar\, att ske i form av bedmning av narrativa och finansiella rapporter och annat relevant material som tas fram av programmet.,The UNDP Water Governance Program (WGP) aims towards assisting countries improve water governance\, building capacities and           mainstreaming effective water resources management\, water supply and  sanitation policy at different levels - local\, national\, regional and global.The support includes earlier UNDP CapNet programme.,The UNDP Water and Ocean Governance Programme (WOGP) is an umbrella
programme composed of a set of coordinated projects and programs. Each project and
program has activities at either local\, national\, regional or global level. The objective
with WOGP is to help countries achieve integrated\, climate-resilient\, sustainable and
equitable management of water and ocean resources\, and universal access to safe water
supply and sanitation\, through improved water and ocean governance\, in turn
contributing to poverty alleviation and human development.

The WOGP is one of the main global mechanisms contributing to the delivery of the
freshwater and ocean aspects of UNDP's main Strategic Plan. It addresses the challenges
related to the Sustainable Development Goals SDG 6 and SDG 14. The focus on
governance and collective efforts towards protecting freshwater and marine resources\,
and delivering related services\, connects WOGP with the broad approach of the 2030
Agenda.

Sidas funding of WOGP is not earmarked to any specific project or activity. Instead\,
UNDP maintains that Sida's support is critical for the cross-programme knowledge
management\, capacity development and coordinated policy advocacy and thought
leadership organised through UNDPs Global Policy Network. This cross-programme
management and coordination is facilitated through the delivery mechanisms of the
UNDP-SIWI Water Governance Facility\, hosted by the Stockholm International Water
Institute (SIWI). The capacity building programme International Capacity Development
Network for Sustainable Water Management (Cap-Net) is hosted by the Global Water
Partnership Organization (GWPO).

title_narrative: UNDP Water & Oceans Governance Programme 2014-2020,UNDP Water & Oceans Governance Programme 2014-2020
description_narrative:
Denna beredning avser ett std till UNDPs Strategi fr Water & Oceans Governance Programme (WOGP) 2014-17. Totalt avtalsbelopp med Sida fr perioden r 121 miljoner kronor och hela strategin r p 148 miljoner USD (1 milijard kronor) inklusive andra givares\, frmst GEFs std\, men exclusive regeringars medfinansiering .
Verksamheternas fokus ligger fortsatt p stdjandet av vattensektorreformer och strkandet av sektorfrvaltning (governance) vad gller vattenresursfrvaltning\, dricksvattenfrsrjning\, sanitet samt hygien genom etablerade mekanismer\, kanaler och program ssom WGF\, GoAL-WaSH och Shared Waters Partnership. 
Sidas bedmning r att planerade verksamheter och aktiviteter kommer att kunna genomfras som planerat och i enlighet med uppsatta ml och frvntade resultat i UNDPs strategi. 
Den valda finansieringsformen r ett icke-ronmrkt programbaserat (PBA) gvobistnd. Koordinering sker dels genom ett rligt mte samt i direkt dialog med UNDP. Uppfljning kommer\, frutom genom rsgenomgngar\, att ske i form av bedmning av narrativa och finansiella rapporter och annat relevant material som tas fram av programmet.,The UNDP Water Governance Program (WGP) aims towards assisting countries improve water governance\, building capacities and           mainstreaming effective water resources management\, water supply and  sanitation policy at different levels - local\, national\, regional and global.The support includes earlier UNDP CapNet programme.,The UNDP Water and Ocean Governance Programme (WOGP) is an umbrella
programme composed of a set of coordinated projects and programs. Each project and
program has activities at either local\, national\, regional or global level. The objective
with WOGP is to help countries achieve integrated\, climate-resilient\, sustainable and
equitable management of water and ocean resources\, and universal access to safe water
supply and sanitation\, through improved water and ocean governance\, in turn
contributing to poverty alleviation and human development.

The WOGP is one of the main global mechanisms contributing to the delivery of the
freshwater and ocean aspects of UNDP's main Strategic Plan. It addresses the challenges
related to the Sustainable Development Goals SDG 6 and SDG 14. The focus on
governance and collective efforts towards protecting freshwater and marine resources\,
and delivering related services\, connects WOGP with the broad approach of the 2030
Agenda.

Sidas funding of WOGP is not earmarked to any specific project or activity. Instead\,
UNDP maintains that Sida's support is critical for the cross-programme knowledge
management\, capacity development and coordinated policy advocacy and thought
leadership organised through UNDPs Global Policy Network. This cross-programme
management and coordination is facilitated through the delivery mechanisms of the
UNDP-SIWI Water Governance Facility\, hosted by the Stockholm International Water
Institute (SIWI). The capacity building programme International Capacity Development
Network for Sustainable Water Management (Cap-Net) is hosted by the Global Water
Partnership Organization (GWPO).
