description_narrative: D'ici 2013\, les Centres nutritionnels\, les Ecoles Amies des Enfants et les Centres de Sant Intgrs ainsi que les communauts\rdans les districts  hydrogologie favorable  la technologie des forages  faible cot ont accs  des sources d'eau amliores de\rfaon durable\, which contributes to Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations\, Research And Data\, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result:  D'ici 2013\, les enfants sont protgs contre les maladies hydriques\, oro-fcales et environnementales dans 20 Districts du Niger.

This contributes to the following Country Programme result:  D'ici 2013\, les enfants sont protgs contre les maladies hydriques\, oro-fcales et environnementales dans 20 Districts du Niger.
participating_org_narrative: Australia,French Committee for UNICEF,Swedish Committee for UNICEF,ONG CISP COMITATO INTERNAZIONALE PER LO SVILUPPO DEI POPOLI,UNICEF,UNICEF Regular Resources,DR P PF PE AGADEZ,Norway,UNICEF,United States Fund for UNICEF,CABINET DU PREMIER

description_narrative: Output 3.3: By 2018\, the water and sanitation sector has a strategy\, a coordination mechanism\, an effective monitoring and\revaluation system and strengthened capacities\, which contributes to Wash  General\, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018\, children\, in particular the most vulnerable\, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation\rfacilities in schools\, health centers and communities to prevent diseases\, including in emergency situations.

description_narrative: Output 3.3: By 2018\, the water and sanitation sector has a strategy\, a coordination mechanism\, an effective monitoring and\revaluation system and strengthened capacities\, which contributes to Wash  General\, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018\, children\, in particular the most vulnerable\, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation\rfacilities in schools\, health centers and communities to prevent diseases\, including in emergency situations.

description_narrative: New Element\, which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty\, Safe And Equitable Water\, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices\, Safe And Equitable Water\, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices  (Covid)\, Water\, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement\, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships\, Risk-Informed Humanitarian And Development Nexus Programming\, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building\, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys\, especially the most vulnerable\, and those in humanitarian situations\, use safe and clean drinking water and\rsanitation services in a clean and safe environment and adopt appropriate hygiene practices.

reporting_org_narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
title_narrative: Programme dHydraulique Rurale  Appui Au Secteur Eau et Assainissement (PHRASEA) Phase 2
description_narrative: Moins de 50% des nigriens ont accs  leau potable et seuls 7% disposent de conditions d'assainissement de base. La croissance dmographique galopante\, la dispersion de la population sur le territoire et la prcarit des finances publiques sont des contraintes empchant l'accs des populations  ces services de base. Le PHRASEA vient en appui aux efforts du gouvernement\, en misant sur la maitrise douvrage des communes.

Le PHRASEA vient en appui aux efforts du gouvernement\, en misant sur la maitrise douvrage des communes.

title_narrative: Satellite Based Water Monitoring and Flow Forecasting (Implementation Phase)
description_narrative: The project consists of the following elements:- Implementation of the satellite based Energy and Water Balance Monitoring System (EWBMS) which on a daily basis will provide climatic data fields of temperature  radiation evapotranspiration and precipitation- Implementation of the Large Scale Hydrological Model (LSHM) which uses the data from the EWBMS to generate river flow rates and forecasts- Implementation of the Drought Monitoring System (DMS) which will provide meteorological hydrological agricultural and climatological drought information for the entire basin- Testing calibration validation and optimisation of the systems provided- Creation and training of an operational satellite monitoring unit at NBA responsible for operating these systems and diffusing the data and related information products among users in the member countries-Training of users.
participating_org_narrative: Invest International,Invest International,EARS B.V.,eLEAF B.V.,Niger Basin Authority,Ministre de l'Eau et de l'Environnement
sector: Water resources conservation (including data collection)

reporting_org_narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands
description_narrative: Le programme Promotion de l'agriculture productive fait partie du programme de coopration conomique de Dveloppement rural et a griculture productive au sein du secteur Agriculture productive et scurit alimentaire de la cooprative allemande avec le Niger. Ce programme a dmarr en 2011. La demande concerne une coopration dlgue avec la GIZ\, avec une demande d'un montant de 4 millions (2 MEURO mars 2020\, encore 2 MEURO pour 2021). L'objectif du programme est de faire en sorte que le secteur agricole au Niger contribue davantage  la croissance conomique nationale et  la scurit alimentaire par l'irrigation  petite chelle. L'accs  une irrigation stable encourage la diversification des produits agricoles et prolonge la priode de production. Cela entrane  son tour une plus grande autonomie et une augmentation des revenus.
participating_org_narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands,Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands,Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands,GTZ
sector: Water resources conservation (including data collection)

title_narrative: Development of a roadmap for an inclusive and sustainable water governance structure for the river Niger in Niger
description_narrative: The purpose of this project is to contribute an expert planning perspective to the development of a roadmap that will lead to an inclusive and sustainable water governance structure for the river Niger in Niger (country). Good governance of the area of the river is essential for the livelihood of millions of people\, the economy of the country and to prevent conflicts. Especially in the context of rapid climate change and extreme weather (and floods) occurring more often. This project will facilitate the planning process for the development of this roadmap in the beginning of 2021.
participating_org_narrative: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,Van Beek Water Delft,Netherlands Enterprise Agency
sector: Water supply and sanitation - large systems

UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations\, Research And Data\, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result:  D'ici 2013\, les enfants sont protgs contre les maladies hydriques\, oro-fcales et environnementales dans 20 Districts du Niger.

description_narrative: D'ici 2013\, les Centres nutritionnels\, les Ecoles Amies des Enfants et les Centres de Sant Intgrs ainsi que les communauts\rdans les districts  hydrogologie favorable  la technologie des forages  faible cot ont accs  des sources d'eau amliores de\rfaon durable\, which contributes to Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations\, Research And Data\, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result:  D'ici 2013\, les enfants sont protgs contre les maladies hydriques\, oro-fcales et environnementales dans 20 Districts du Niger.

description_narrative: Output 3.2: By 2018\, households\, including children and adolescents\, adopt favourable behaviours for improving hygiene and\rsanitation conditions at community level\, in schools and health facilities\, which contributes to Hygiene\, Sanitation\, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres\, Water\, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations\, Research And Data\, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018\, children\, in particular the most vulnerable\, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation\rfacilities in schools\, health centers and communities to prevent diseases\, including in emergency situations.

This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018\, children\, in particular the most vulnerable\, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation\rfacilities in schools\, health centers and communities to prevent diseases\, including in emergency situations.

description_narrative: Output 3.2: By 2018\, households\, including children and adolescents\, adopt favourable behaviours for improving hygiene and\rsanitation conditions at community level\, in schools and health facilities\, which contributes to Hygiene\, Sanitation\, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres\, Water\, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations\, Research And Data\, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018\, children\, in particular the most vulnerable\, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation\rfacilities in schools\, health centers and communities to prevent diseases\, including in emergency situations.

title_narrative: EQUITABLE Water\, Sanitation\, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES
description_narrative: Municipalities\, private operators\, NGOs and community-based management structures have improved capacity to equitably provide WASH\rservices at the community level\, in schools and in health facilities\, including in humanitarian situations.\, which contributes to Climate Change\, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation\, Evaluation\, Research\, Safe And Equitable Water\, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices\, Water\, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement\, Evaluations\, Research And Data\, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building\, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys\, especially the most vulnerable\, and those in humanitarian situations\, use safe and clean drinking water and\rsanitation services in a clean and safe environment and adopt appropriate hygiene practices.

title_narrative: SOCIAL & BEHAVIOUR CHANGE FOR Water\, Sanitation\, and Hygiene (WASH)
description_narrative: Households and communities\, including those in humanitarian situations\, have increased capacity to adopt behaviours conducive to\rimproving Water\, Sanitation\, and Hygiene (WASH) practices.\, which contributes to Climate Change\, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation\, Evaluation\, Research\, Safe And Equitable Water\, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices\, Water\, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement\, Community Engagement\, Social And Behaviour Change\, Evaluations\, Research And Data\, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building\, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys\, especially the most vulnerable\, and those in humanitarian situations\, use safe and clean drinking water and\rsanitation services in a clean and safe environment and adopt appropriate hygiene practices.

This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys\, especially the most vulnerable\, and those in humanitarian situations\, use safe and clean drinking water and\rsanitation services in a clean and safe environment and adopt appropriate hygiene practices.

title_narrative: Karey Gorou - Projet de renforcement de l'alimentation en eau de Niamey
description_narrative: Le projet comprend la ralisation d'une prise d'eau sur le fleuve Niger ainsi que la premire tranche de l'usine d'eau potable de Karey Gorou pour une capacit de traitement de 100000 m/j\, la pose de prs de 800 km de canalisation d'eau potable\, la construction de 6 rservoirs et 13 stations de pompage\, la cration de 45 000 branchements sociaux. Un volet d'accompagnement et de renforcement des capacits de la matrise d'ouvrage permettra d'appuyer la mise en uvre du projet. Dispositif social
participating_org_narrative: France,AFD,REPUBLIQUE DU NIGER
sector: Water supply - large systems
sector_narrative: ALIMENTATION EN EAU - SYSTEMES A GRANDE ECHELLE,Dveloppement durable
transaction_description_narrative: Commitment

description_narrative: This study explores the commercialization of the data of a key regional socioeconomic institution in the Sahel; the Niger Basin Authority (NBA). A previous RVO/DRIVE project has created an early-warning algorithm for NBA which predicts floods and droughts of the Niger river. As the vast population of Niger is dependent on rainfed agriculture\, this information is of value. By analysing commercialization options\, the operation of the algorithm can potentially be sustained in the long run. Potential adverse consequences of the commercialization of this data - such as the disruption of the market - are assessed. Besides\, the study indicates to what extent and how the commercialization of this type of data can potentially offer employment opportunities for youngsters locally.
participating_org_narrative: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,Stichting Akvo,Netherlands Enterprise Agency
sector: Water supply - large systems

title_narrative: Extension of the existing water supply system in Niamey (Implementation Phase)
description_narrative: The drinking water of Niamey is currently supplied by four water treatment works (Goudel I\, II\, III and Yantala) with a maximum capacity of 110\,000 m3/day. The system is at the moment able to produce and distribute enough drinking water to the population of Niamey (1.1 million inhabitants and an average total water demand above 85\,000 m3/day in 2012). However\, the maximal production capacity has already been reached in peak periods\, and with an annual population growth of over 4%\, the existing drinking water production capacity would lead to severe water shortages in the near future. With the EWSN project\, the competent authority SPEN wants to increase the existing capacity in order to meet the demand until approximately 2020.The project is defined as the extension of the existing water supply system in Niamey through the rehabilitation of an existing raw water intake\, the development\, construction\, equipping\, subsequent commissioning and operation of a new drinking water treatment plant with a capacity of 40\,000 m3/day (Goudel IV)\, and the extension and improvement of the current transmission and distribution network. This project will ultimately benefit approximately 381\,000 additional inhabitants within a 10-year period\, thus ensuring proper drinking water supply for the whole population of Niamey.
participating_org_narrative: Invest International,Societe De Patrimoine des Eaux Du Niger,SGI Ingnierie SA,Cabinet EDE International,DENYS,Invest International
sector: Water supply - large systems

However\, the maximal production capacity has already been reached in peak periods\, and with an annual population growth of over 4%\, the existing drinking water production capacity would lead to severe water shortages in the near future. With the EWSN project\, the competent authority SPEN wants to increase the existing capacity in order to meet the demand until approximately 2020.The project is defined as the extension of the existing water supply system in Niamey through the rehabilitation of an existing raw water intake\, the development\, construction\, equipping\, subsequent commissioning and operation of a new drinking water treatment plant with a capacity of 40\,000 m3/day (Goudel IV)\, and the extension and improvement of the current transmission and distribution network. This project will ultimately benefit approximately 381\,000 additional inhabitants within a 10-year period\, thus ensuring proper drinking water supply for the whole population of Niamey.
participating_org_narrative: Invest International,Societe De Patrimoine des Eaux Du Niger,SGI Ingnierie SA,Cabinet EDE International,DENYS,Invest International
sector: Water supply - large systems

With the EWSN project\, the competent authority SPEN wants to increase the existing capacity in order to meet the demand until approximately 2020.The project is defined as the extension of the existing water supply system in Niamey through the rehabilitation of an existing raw water intake\, the development\, construction\, equipping\, subsequent commissioning and operation of a new drinking water treatment plant with a capacity of 40\,000 m3/day (Goudel IV)\, and the extension and improvement of the current transmission and distribution network. This project will ultimately benefit approximately 381\,000 additional inhabitants within a 10-year period\, thus ensuring proper drinking water supply for the whole population of Niamey.
participating_org_narrative: Invest International,Societe De Patrimoine des Eaux Du Niger,SGI Ingnierie SA,Cabinet EDE International,DENYS,Invest International
sector: Water supply - large systems

title_narrative: Extension of the existing water supply system in Niamey (Development Phase)
description_narrative: The capacity of the raw water intake in the Niger River has to be increased by rehabilitating a currently abandoned raw water intake. Next to the construction works for the new water treatment plant (Goudel IV). Additions will be made to the existing pre-treatment facility and pumping station including a new disinfection contact chamber for disinfection and pH correction. A new chemical building new high lift pumps and a new emergency generator.The drinking water transmission and distribution network has been expanded many times and has a somewhat erratic layout. A distinction can be made between transmission pipes and distribution pipes. In general  water is transported through transmission pipes to reservoirs spread through the city from the pumping stations at the treatment plants.Distribution pipes are connected to the reservoirs from where drinking water is supplied to customers. Especially in the older parts distribution pipes are also directly connected to the transmission pipes. The existing network will be improved and extended with additional transmission pipes  reservoirs  distribution pipes  individual connections and stand pipes.
participating_org_narrative: Witteveen+Bos Raadgevende Ingenieurs B.V.,SGI Ingnierie SA,DENYS,Societe De Patrimoine des Eaux Du Niger,Ministere Du Plan,Invest International,Invest International

title_narrative: 3.1 IMPROVED ACCESS TO SAFE DRINKG WATER
description_narrative: Output 3.1: By 2018\, communities\, schools and health facilities in the most-at-risk geographic areas have improved\, sustainable\raccess to safe drinking water and sanitation\, which contributes to Sanitation\, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres\, Wash  General\, Water\, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018\, children\, in particular the most vulnerable\, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation\rfacilities in schools\, health centers and communities to prevent diseases\, including in emergency situations.

description_narrative: Output 3.1: By 2018\, communities\, schools and health facilities in the most-at-risk geographic areas have improved\, sustainable\raccess to safe drinking water and sanitation\, which contributes to Sanitation\, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres\, Wash  General\, Water\, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018\, children\, in particular the most vulnerable\, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation\rfacilities in schools\, health centers and communities to prevent diseases\, including in emergency situations.

reporting_org_narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
description_narrative: Le programme renforcera les capacits des diffrents acteurs parties prenantes pour quils soient  terme capables de porter eux-mmes et de faon durable le dispositif et les investissements raliss. Il tablira des mcanismes de financement des infrastructures bass sur lexprience de la DDC au Niger (notamment le Fonds de Soutien aux Investissements Locaux\, FSILs) et prparera les communes  la mise en place ventuelle dun dispositif national dinvestissement (lAgence Nationale pour lInvestissement des Collectivits Territoriales attendue dici 2012) auquel la DDC pourrait envisager de contribuer une fois oprationnel. Le programme travaillera en coordination avec le Programme dAppui au Secteur de lElevage (PASEL) pour soutenir la mise en uvre de la stratgie dintervention nationale en matire dhydraulique pastorale (en prparation) dans les rgions de Maradi et Dosso.
participating_org_narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC),ONG base dans un pays en dveloppement
contact_info_organisation_narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation SDC
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
transaction_description_narrative: Disbursement

title_narrative: Emergency relief for displaced Nigerian households and their hosted population in Diffa (Niger)
description_narrative:
Diffa\, one of the poorest regions of Niger\, has been experiencing a deficit of food production for the past three years. This situation of food insecurity worsened since 2012 by the arrival of displaced populations from Nigeria fleeing attacks by the Boko Haram group. This year more than 100\,000 displaced persons\, the equivalent of 1/5 of Diffas population\, have been identified.

In addition\, the security measures taken by the Government of Niger including the State of emergency\, the prohibition to ride on a motorcycle and attend the banks of the Komadougou Yobe River have had a lasting negative impact on the socio-economic activities in the region. Especially since the surroundings of this River is where the population derives the bulk of its revenues from\, through fishing and the production of green pepper. Another source of income compromised is the border trade. People are no longer able to buy and sell their products on Nigerias market.

CADEV-Niger\, faithful to its mission of supporting vulnerable populations has agreed on the need to demonstrate the Catholic Churchs solidarity to the displaced persons and the host populations.

This project introduced by Caritas Niger has dual objectives. On the one hand it aims to help improving the living conditions of the displaced population\, and on the other hand to help the host populations mitigate the impact of the 2014 food deficit.
participating_org_narrative: Catholic Agency For Overseas Development (CAFOD),Caritas Developpement Niger
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

title_narrative: Improving access to water and Sanitation in Kieche and Baboursaye
description_narrative:
This intervention builds on CADEVs initial experience in the village of Baboursaye and its surrounding homesteads focusing on improved access to water and Hygiene promotion. More specifically\, the project aims to: 
1. Build one borehole in the village of Baboursaye and two rope pumps in two major hamlets of Baboursaye to reduce time spent collecting water and provide additional water resources for Human consumption\, drinking by animals and watering of crops.
2. Train and equip community water point management committee members to maintain hygiene around water points and promote safe handling of water to reduce contamination throughout the key moments of the water handling (Collection\, treatment\, storage and distribution/consumption)
3. Support community driven sanitation and hygiene promotion initiatives including awareness raising and behaviour change communication activities
4. Train and equip at least 50 women in the village of Baboursaye to practice irrigated small gardening so that they become capable of producing vegetables throughout the year (Including during the lean season) for the consumption of their household and sale of any supplementary production.
participating_org_narrative: Catholic Agency For Overseas Development (CAFOD),Caritas Developpement Niamey
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

title_narrative: Helping people to access to lifesaving healthcare in Konni Commune
description_narrative:
Niger is the poorest country in the world. More than 60 percent of people are unable to meet their basic needs. Except for all problems related to drought and unstable rainfall\, the population of Niger faces the major problem of access to quality health care. Less than half of people can access effective health services. Under a third of mothers receive quality care during their pregnancies.
A recent assessment by CAFOD\, one of our local partners and the Ministry of Health revealed that over 75 percent of people have to travel to access healthcare\, some from as far as 35 kilometres across the border in Nigeria. Only one in five pregnant women are able to consistently access healthcare before and after birth. This increases the risk of complications and infant and maternal mortality.
To address this problem in the commune of Konni\, in the Tahoua region\, this project aims to support CADEV Maradi to help Konni communities build and equip a community health facility and as result\, facilitate access to quality health services.
This project will also provide a supply of essential medicines\, train healthcare providers to manage issues related to pregnancy\, childbirth and childhood illness\, promote good health in communities to encourage prevention\, care and participation\, share knowledge about nutrition\, the importance of healthcare during pregnancy and after birth\, immunisations and how to feed infants and establish an early warning system to share health information and help the centre and the community work together effectively to prevent and respond to outbreaks of disease .
participating_org_narrative: Catholic Agency For Overseas Development (CAFOD),Caritas Developpement Maradi
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

title_narrative: Support to people living with disabilities impacted by the Covid-19 pandemic in Niger
description_narrative:
Having registered its first case on March 29\, 2020\, Niger has accumulated by January 30\, 2021\, 4433 positive cases out of 72624 tests performed. Out of the 4433 positive cases\, 3583 cases have been declared cured\, 153 people have died and 697 active cases are being treated.
This pandemic context aggravates an already unstable and poor health situation characterised by persistent seasonal epidemics (meningitis\, measles)\, a high mortality rate (Maternal mortality rate: 509 per 100\,000 live births\, Deaths under five: 85 per 1\,000 live births) against the backdrop of a very weak health system and factors that increase the vulnerability of the population or facilitate the spread of the virus (drought\, food insecurity\, transhumance\, difficulty of access to water).
The negative impact of this pandemic is not only health-related\, but also economic\, especially in a country where human development indicators are very low\, making Niger one of the poorest countries in the world\, chronically affecting more than a quarter of the population (26.8%). 
This impact is much more pronounced among the disabled population than among the rest of the population. People with disabilities are particularly disadvantaged by the socio-economic consequences of COVID-19 and the measures taken to control the pandemic. 
The risk of contracting COVID-19 is higher among people with disabilities and the risk of medical complications and death related to COVID-19 is higher among people with disabilities.
With an estimated population of 22.8 million\, Niger is one of the countries with one of the highest natural population growth rates in the world (3.9% per year)1 and the disabled population is estimated at 4.2% (2.11% women and 2.06% men) .

This project therefore aims to support people with disabilities to reduce the considerable economic and health impact that this pandemic has on their daily lives by providing them with food to meet their immediate needs but also by supporting their income-generating activities and ensuring the strengthening of their capacities or by accompanying them in learning the profession in order to strengthen their long-term resilience.
This project will support people with disabilities to become stakeholders in the prevention of Covid-19 by raising their awareness of the barriers against Covid-19\, by training and supporting women with disabilities in the sewing of masks in line with government recommendations. Hand washing kits adapted to people with disabilities as well as other pandemic prevention equipment and products will be distributed to the beneficiaries (disinfectant gels).
participating_org_narrative: Catholic Agency For Overseas Development (CAFOD),Caritas Developpement Niamey
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

title_narrative: Project to support Covid-19 prevention initiatives in Niger
description_narrative:
Being a deeply rural Sahelian country\, Niger records rainfall over a period of three months. This is the period when the majority of the population is active in agriculture. During the other nine months of the year\, it is traditional for people to migrate to neighbouring countries to work at small jobs in order to survive during the lean season. This phenomenon is amplified by the porosity of the borders. These uncontrolled movements of people (especially after the reopening of land borders borders in June 2021 for purely economic reasons after their closure at the beginning of the pandemic) are at the origin of several problems that the state has to face\, such as insecurity\, extremism\, human trafficking and the high risk of circulating diseases from one area to another\, especially Covid-19.

Concerning the application of barrier measures\, internally\, it should be noted that the population has greatly lowered its guard and no longer scrupulously applies the barrier measures recommended by the Ministry of Health. This situation is relatively due to the lack of an adequate communication and the circulation of messages of disinformation.

As for vaccination\, it was launched on 29 March 2021 with AstraZeneca and Sinopharma vaccines. 
However\, in view of the results obtained\, only about 3.3% of the targeted population of 10\,318\,339 people have been vaccinated. Additional efforts are still required to reach the vaccination targets recommended to country\, namely 10% of the population vaccinated by September 2021 and 30% by December 2021.To reach this goal\, raising awareness among the population remains the key to success in a country where bad rumours are circulating to discourage the population from being vaccinated.
This project will therefore contribute to prevention through awareness raising activities on barrier measures and the usefulness of vaccination and distribution of Covid-19 prevention products and equipment in border regions which currently represent high risk areas after the reopening of land borders and may serve as entry points for several cases of different Covid-19 variants from different neighbouring countries.
participating_org_narrative: Catholic Agency For Overseas Development (CAFOD),Caritas Developpement Niger
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

title_narrative: MERF Maradi Emergency Response to Nigerian Refugee Influx
description_narrative: Growing insecurity in Sokoto and Zamfara states in northwestern Nigeria\, bordering Niger\, has resulted in the cross border displacement of roughly 20\,000 Nigerian refugees. The displacements started in Zamfara at low levels in the late summer of 2018 as a result of criminality and unrest. In April and May 2019\, the numbers spiralled as thousands of Nigerians fled to Niger from neigbouring Sokoto State\, fleeing rampant kidnapping\, banditry\, sexual violence and killings. The violence is generally (though not excusively) thought to be caused by a combination of inter-communal violence and banditry\, rather than the violent jihadism wihch characterizes North-East Nigeria. The Nigerian states of Sokoto and Zamfara from which the displaced populations originate is hard to reach and has few humanitarian actors on the ground\, so reliable information on the violence there is hard to find (source: REACH Rapid Briefing Note: Niger  Maradi\, 27 June\, 2019).
participating_org_narrative: World Vision United Kingdom,World Vision United Kingdom,World Vision International,Start Network,World Vision Niger,Centre for Excellence and Development Impact and Learning
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
sector_narrative: Water and sanitation

title_narrative: Independent Process Monitoring and Evaluation(IPME) of the DFID contribution to the UNICEF Programme  Accelerating Sanitation and Water for All (SWA) in Neglected\, Off-Track Countries
description_narrative:
Accelerating Sanitation and Water for All in Off Track Countries is a multi-country water\, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) project supported by the Department for international Development (DFID). 
The projects focus includes WASH interventions in up to 12 countries in Africa\, South Asia and South East Asia that are not on-track to meet the Millennium Development Goal WASH Target 7c. The following nine countries have been selected by DFID and UNICEF\, DFIDs implementing partner\, to participate in the project: Bangladesh; Cambodia; Madagascar; Myanmar; Nepal; Niger; Pakistan; South Sudan; and Yemen
The aims and objectives of IPME are two-fold. 
First\, it will assess programme results and performance\, and formulate recommendations to allow programme improvements to be made in real time. 
Second\, it will design/develop/implement a robust impact and process evaluation framework to address key questions for the design/implementation of ASWA/ future WASH programmes.
participating_org_narrative: UK Department for International Development,United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF)
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

description_narrative:
Providing humanitarian assistance and building the resilience of pastoralist and agropastoralist communities in Niger
Main objective: To provide humanitarian assistance and strengthen resilience of the most vulnerable communities affected by food crisesand recurrent floods
Objective 1: Integrating community warning systems in the national early warning system and make it functional and durable
Objective 2: Establishing social safety nets to improve food security and nutritional status of householdschronically vulnerable
Objective 3: Strengthening livelihoods of vulnerable agropastoral communities through the implementation of community projects
Objective 4: Improving access to drinking water to communities
Objective 5: Reducing the risk of malnutrition in the areas of interventionthrough the dissemination of messages on hygiene and malnutrition\, screening and referral of malnourished
participating_org_narrative:
Oxfam Novib,ONG ADKOUL,The NGO ADKOUL was founded in 2001 by a group of students and professionals wanting to do something about poverty and to contributeto the development of the country.
The organisation wants to enable vulnerable communities to satisfy their basic needs and to ensure their sustainable access to basic social services in order to improve their living condiitons.
The organisation is active in the following areas: food security\,  education\, literacy training\, water supply\,  health\, environmental issues\, pastoral economy\, peace and decentralisation .
The organisation works in the following regions in Niger: Tahoua and Agadez.,OXFAM GB,Oxfam Novib

description_narrative:
Main Objective is to contribute to the establishment of sustainable peace between communities living in  Niger and Mali border
Specific objectives are:
1 Create conditions for a permanent inter-community dialogue
2 Strengthen governance capacity of local and traditional authorities
3 Improve access and management of shared natural resources and economic resources

Expected results
R11 Persistent perceptions are broken\, the spirit of mutual understanding is created and a dynamic collaboration / consultation established
R12A permanent consultation mechanism between different community groups is operational
R21 The capacity of local and traditional authorities care of the problems of all communities under their administration\, is improved
R22 Community participation\, particularly youth\, in public life is improved and the representation of local and traditional authorities is reinforced
R31 The mesh (geographicaldistribution) of basic social infrastructure has improved the internal mobility of pastoralists
R32 Existing legal provisions are taken into account by all actors in the management of natural resources and social infrastructure
R33 Opportunities for socio-economic integration are created and entered by youth at risk
participating_org_narrative:
Oxfam Novib,Oxfam GB au Sngal West Africa Regional Office,Oxfam Great Britain is a member of Oxfam International\, a confederation of 17 independent national organizations working in more than 90 countries.

Oxfam works on six goals that support the shared vision of a just world without poverty: help people claim their right to a better life; champion equal rights for women; saving lives\, now and in the future; safeguard global food supplies; help people claim a fairer share of natural resources; and increase money for basic services.
For 70 years\, Oxfam has been running emergency responses\, development projects and campaigning at the grass roots level to tackle poverty.,European Union,Oxfam Novib

description_narrative: Assignment at the request of UNICEF Niger. Under the supervision of Chief WASH\, and in close collaboration with the WASH team Office\, the Emergency WASH Specialist will have responsibility to support the implementation and monitoring of UNICEF emergency WASH response in Niger. The Emergency WASH Specialist will support the planning\, development\, implementation and monitoring of the emergency WASH program. Based on UNICEFs Strategic Plan\, its Core Commitments for Children (CCCs) in emergencies and the Minimum Standards for WASH in Humanitarian Action\, the Emergency WASH Specialist will carry out functions relating to strategic advice and program management\, partnership\, and internal and external coordination.
participating_org_narrative: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,UNICEF,Netherlands Enterprise Agency
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

title_narrative: COVID-19 Swedish Mission Council frame 2017-2021,COVID-19 SMR Svenska missionsrdet\, insatsavtal 2017-2021
description_narrative:
Omprogrammerade medel fr att bekmpa covid-19Omprogrammerade medel fr att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19SMR har inkommit med en tillggsanskan om Sida-bidrag fr 2018-2019 om totalt 
122 000 000 SEK.

TILLGGSANSKAN
Infr denna avtalsperiod har Pingstmissionens utvecklingssamarbete (PMU) inte ftt frnyad status som ramorganisation hos Sida och fr drmed inte lngre direkt std frn CSO-anslaget. Istllet har PMU\, som r en medlemsorganisation till SMR\, valt att ska bidrag fr projekt till std fr civila samhllet i utvecklingslnder frn SMR\, som vidarefrmedlar bidrag frn CSO-anslaget. SMR har redan infr det nuvarande underavtalet fr perioden 2017-2021 ftt erbjudandet av Sida att komplettera med en tillggsanskan fr perioden 2018-2019 som motsvarar SMR:s bedmning och rekommendationer om std till PMU. Drefter har PMU inkommit till SMR med en anskan om bidrag frn SMR fr perioden 2018-2019. 

BUDGET
SMR ansker totalt om 122 000 000 SEK fr tvrsperioden 2018-2019\, utver det redan avtalade beloppet om 790 000 000 SEK. Detta r samma belopp som PMU anskt om till SMR. SMR:s totala budget fr tillggsanskan 2018-2019 r p 134 551 400 SEK (inklusive 12 551 400 SEK i egeninsats). Frdelningen mellan SMR\, deras svenska medlemsorganisationer och de lokala samarbetspartnerna frndras ngot fr den perioden som tillggsanskan avser. Med utgngspunkt i den totala budgeten fr tillggsanskan 2018-2019 kar andelen som stannar hos de svenska medlemsorganisationerna frn 13 % till 19 % och andelen som stannar hos de lokala samarbetspartnerna minskar motsvarande frn 81 % till 75 %. Fortsatt stannar omkring 6 % hos SMR.  

GRUND FR SIDAS BEDMNING
Beredningen har till strst del grundat sig p SMR:s insatsbedmning av PMU:s programanskan\, men ven SMR:s organisationsbedmning av PMU och Sidas uppfljning av SMR och PMU i Kenya\, maj 2017. Sida har ven haft tillgng till PMU:s programanskan till SMR\, samt PMU:s respons p SMR:s kompletterande frgor gllande anskan. 

BEREDNINGEN
Eftersom insatsen bereds som ett kompletterande insatsbeslut har beredningen i s stor utstrckning som mjligt utgtt frn den omfattande beredning som gjordes av anskan fr den pgende avtalsperioden 2017-2021. D bedmningen som gjordes av anskan 2017-2021 fortsatt r relevant har denna behllits och kompletterande kommentarer gllande 2018-2019 har lagts till dr tillggsanskan franleder en uppdaterad kompletterande bedmning. De revideringar som gjorts av beredningen berr drfr endast perioden 2018-2019.,Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19SMR has submitted an additional application for Sida grants for 2018-2019 in total
122\,000\,000 SEK.

ADDITIONAL APPLICATION
Prior to this agreement period\, the Pentecostal Mission's development cooperation (PMU) has not been given renewed status as a framework organization at Sida and thus no longer receives direct support from the CSO grant. Instead\, PMU\, which is a member organization of SMR\, has chosen to apply for grants for projects in support of civil society in developing countries from SMR\, which pass on grants from the CSO grant. Prior to the current sub-agreement for the period 2017-2021\, SMR has already received an offer from Sida to supplement it with an additional application for the period 2018-2019\, which corresponds to SMR's assessment and recommendations for support to PMU. Subsequently\, PMU has submitted to SMR with an application for a grant from SMR for the period 2018-2019.

BUDGET
SMR is applying for a total of SEK 122\,000\,000 for the two-year period 2018-2019\, in addition to the already agreed amount of SEK 790\,000\,000. This is the same amount that the PMU applied for to SMR. SMR's total budget for the supplementary application 2018-2019 is SEK 134\,551\,400 (including SEK 12\,551\,400 in own contribution). The distribution between SMR\, their Swedish member organizations and the local partners changes somewhat for the period to which the supplementary application relates. Based on the total budget for the supplementary application 2018-2019\, the proportion staying with the Swedish member organizations increases from 13% to 19% and the proportion staying with the local partners decreases correspondingly from 81% to 75%. About 6% still stay with SMR.

BASIS FOR PAGE ASSESSMENT
The preparation has largely been based on SMR's input assessment of PMU's program application\, but also SMR's organizational assessment of PMU and Sida's follow-up of SMR and PMU in Kenya\, May 2017. Sida has also had access to PMU's program application to SMR\, and the PMU's response to SMR's supplementary questions regarding the application.

THE PREPARATION
Since the intervention is prepared as a supplementary intervention decision\, the preparation has\, as far as possible\, been based on the extensive preparation made of the application for the ongoing agreement period 2017-2021. As the assessment made of the application 2017-2021 is still relevant\, this has been retained and supplementary comments regarding 2018-2019 have been added where the additional application causes an updated supplementary assessment. The revisions made by the committee therefore only affect the period 2018-2019.,vergripande ml fr SMR:s verksamhetsomrde 'Lngsiktigt utvecklingssamarbete' (som styr merparten av Sida-finansierade verksamheten):

"Att bidra till utvecklingen av ett hllbart\, rttvist\, fredligt\, jmstllt och demokratiskt samhlle i samarbetslnderna\, dr de mnskliga rttigheterna respekteras\, skyddas och uppfylls\, genom std och kapacitetsutveckling till frndringsaktrer med legitimitet och frmga att arbeta rttighetsbaserat fr att utkrva ansvar av skyldighetsbrare och att strka rttighetsinnehavares organisering\, egenmakt och frutsttningar att sjlva frndra sina livsvillkor."
participating_org_narrative: Sweden,SMR/Svenska Missionsrdet,Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency,SMR/Svenska Missionsrdet
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
sector_narrative: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation,Water Supply & Sanitation

title_narrative: COVID-19 Swedish Mission Council frame 2017-2021,COVID-19 SMR Svenska missionsrdet\, insatsavtal 2017-2021
description_narrative:
Omprogrammerade medel fr att bekmpa covid-19Omprogrammerade medel fr att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19SMR har inkommit med en tillggsanskan om Sida-bidrag fr 2018-2019 om totalt 
122 000 000 SEK.

TILLGGSANSKAN
Infr denna avtalsperiod har Pingstmissionens utvecklingssamarbete (PMU) inte ftt frnyad status som ramorganisation hos Sida och fr drmed inte lngre direkt std frn CSO-anslaget. Istllet har PMU\, som r en medlemsorganisation till SMR\, valt att ska bidrag fr projekt till std fr civila samhllet i utvecklingslnder frn SMR\, som vidarefrmedlar bidrag frn CSO-anslaget. SMR har redan infr det nuvarande underavtalet fr perioden 2017-2021 ftt erbjudandet av Sida att komplettera med en tillggsanskan fr perioden 2018-2019 som motsvarar SMR:s bedmning och rekommendationer om std till PMU. Drefter har PMU inkommit till SMR med en anskan om bidrag frn SMR fr perioden 2018-2019. 

BUDGET
SMR ansker totalt om 122 000 000 SEK fr tvrsperioden 2018-2019\, utver det redan avtalade beloppet om 790 000 000 SEK. Detta r samma belopp som PMU anskt om till SMR. SMR:s totala budget fr tillggsanskan 2018-2019 r p 134 551 400 SEK (inklusive 12 551 400 SEK i egeninsats). Frdelningen mellan SMR\, deras svenska medlemsorganisationer och de lokala samarbetspartnerna frndras ngot fr den perioden som tillggsanskan avser. Med utgngspunkt i den totala budgeten fr tillggsanskan 2018-2019 kar andelen som stannar hos de svenska medlemsorganisationerna frn 13 % till 19 % och andelen som stannar hos de lokala samarbetspartnerna minskar motsvarande frn 81 % till 75 %. Fortsatt stannar omkring 6 % hos SMR.  

GRUND FR SIDAS BEDMNING
Beredningen har till strst del grundat sig p SMR:s insatsbedmning av PMU:s programanskan\, men ven SMR:s organisationsbedmning av PMU och Sidas uppfljning av SMR och PMU i Kenya\, maj 2017. Sida har ven haft tillgng till PMU:s programanskan till SMR\, samt PMU:s respons p SMR:s kompletterande frgor gllande anskan. 

BEREDNINGEN
Eftersom insatsen bereds som ett kompletterande insatsbeslut har beredningen i s stor utstrckning som mjligt utgtt frn den omfattande beredning som gjordes av anskan fr den pgende avtalsperioden 2017-2021. D bedmningen som gjordes av anskan 2017-2021 fortsatt r relevant har denna behllits och kompletterande kommentarer gllande 2018-2019 har lagts till dr tillggsanskan franleder en uppdaterad kompletterande bedmning. De revideringar som gjorts av beredningen berr drfr endast perioden 2018-2019.,Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19SMR has submitted an additional application for Sida grants for 2018-2019 in total
122\,000\,000 SEK.

ADDITIONAL APPLICATION
Prior to this agreement period\, the Pentecostal Mission's development cooperation (PMU) has not been given renewed status as a framework organization at Sida and thus no longer receives direct support from the CSO grant. Instead\, PMU\, which is a member organization of SMR\, has chosen to apply for grants for projects in support of civil society in developing countries from SMR\, which pass on grants from the CSO grant. Prior to the current sub-agreement for the period 2017-2021\, SMR has already received an offer from Sida to supplement it with an additional application for the period 2018-2019\, which corresponds to SMR's assessment and recommendations for support to PMU. Subsequently\, PMU has submitted to SMR with an application for a grant from SMR for the period 2018-2019.

BUDGET
SMR is applying for a total of SEK 122\,000\,000 for the two-year period 2018-2019\, in addition to the already agreed amount of SEK 790\,000\,000. This is the same amount that the PMU applied for to SMR. SMR's total budget for the supplementary application 2018-2019 is SEK 134\,551\,400 (including SEK 12\,551\,400 in own contribution). The distribution between SMR\, their Swedish member organizations and the local partners changes somewhat for the period to which the supplementary application relates. Based on the total budget for the supplementary application 2018-2019\, the proportion staying with the Swedish member organizations increases from 13% to 19% and the proportion staying with the local partners decreases correspondingly from 81% to 75%. About 6% still stay with SMR.

BASIS FOR PAGE ASSESSMENT
The preparation has largely been based on SMR's input assessment of PMU's program application\, but also SMR's organizational assessment of PMU and Sida's follow-up of SMR and PMU in Kenya\, May 2017. Sida has also had access to PMU's program application to SMR\, and the PMU's response to SMR's supplementary questions regarding the application.

THE PREPARATION
Since the intervention is prepared as a supplementary intervention decision\, the preparation has\, as far as possible\, been based on the extensive preparation made of the application for the ongoing agreement period 2017-2021. As the assessment made of the application 2017-2021 is still relevant\, this has been retained and supplementary comments regarding 2018-2019 have been added where the additional application causes an updated supplementary assessment. The revisions made by the committee therefore only affect the period 2018-2019.,vergripande ml fr SMR:s verksamhetsomrde 'Lngsiktigt utvecklingssamarbete' (som styr merparten av Sida-finansierade verksamheten):

"Att bidra till utvecklingen av ett hllbart\, rttvist\, fredligt\, jmstllt och demokratiskt samhlle i samarbetslnderna\, dr de mnskliga rttigheterna respekteras\, skyddas och uppfylls\, genom std och kapacitetsutveckling till frndringsaktrer med legitimitet och frmga att arbeta rttighetsbaserat fr att utkrva ansvar av skyldighetsbrare och att strka rttighetsinnehavares organisering\, egenmakt och frutsttningar att sjlva frndra sina livsvillkor."
participating_org_narrative: Sweden,SMR/Svenska Missionsrdet,Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency,SMR/Svenska Missionsrdet
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
sector_narrative: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation,Water Supply & Sanitation

Infr denna avtalsperiod har Pingstmissionens utvecklingssamarbete (PMU) inte ftt frnyad status som ramorganisation hos Sida och fr drmed inte lngre direkt std frn CSO-anslaget. Istllet har PMU\, som r en medlemsorganisation till SMR\, valt att ska bidrag fr projekt till std fr civila samhllet i utvecklingslnder frn SMR\, som vidarefrmedlar bidrag frn CSO-anslaget. SMR har redan infr det nuvarande underavtalet fr perioden 2017-2021 ftt erbjudandet av Sida att komplettera med en tillggsanskan fr perioden 2018-2019 som motsvarar SMR:s bedmning och rekommendationer om std till PMU. Drefter har PMU inkommit till SMR med en anskan om bidrag frn SMR fr perioden 2018-2019. 

BUDGET
SMR ansker totalt om 122 000 000 SEK fr tvrsperioden 2018-2019\, utver det redan avtalade beloppet om 790 000 000 SEK. Detta r samma belopp som PMU anskt om till SMR. SMR:s totala budget fr tillggsanskan 2018-2019 r p 134 551 400 SEK (inklusive 12 551 400 SEK i egeninsats). Frdelningen mellan SMR\, deras svenska medlemsorganisationer och de lokala samarbetspartnerna frndras ngot fr den perioden som tillggsanskan avser. Med utgngspunkt i den totala budgeten fr tillggsanskan 2018-2019 kar andelen som stannar hos de svenska medlemsorganisationerna frn 13 % till 19 % och andelen som stannar hos de lokala samarbetspartnerna minskar motsvarande frn 81 % till 75 %. Fortsatt stannar omkring 6 % hos SMR.  

GRUND FR SIDAS BEDMNING
Beredningen har till strst del grundat sig p SMR:s insatsbedmning av PMU:s programanskan\, men ven SMR:s organisationsbedmning av PMU och Sidas uppfljning av SMR och PMU i Kenya\, maj 2017. Sida har ven haft tillgng till PMU:s programanskan till SMR\, samt PMU:s respons p SMR:s kompletterande frgor gllande anskan. 

BEREDNINGEN
Eftersom insatsen bereds som ett kompletterande insatsbeslut har beredningen i s stor utstrckning som mjligt utgtt frn den omfattande beredning som gjordes av anskan fr den pgende avtalsperioden 2017-2021. D bedmningen som gjordes av anskan 2017-2021 fortsatt r relevant har denna behllits och kompletterande kommentarer gllande 2018-2019 har lagts till dr tillggsanskan franleder en uppdaterad kompletterande bedmning. De revideringar som gjorts av beredningen berr drfr endast perioden 2018-2019.,vergripande ml fr SMR:s verksamhetsomrde 'Lngsiktigt utvecklingssamarbete' (som styr merparten av Sida-finansierade verksamheten):

"Att bidra till utvecklingen av ett hllbart\, rttvist\, fredligt\, jmstllt och demokratiskt samhlle i samarbetslnderna\, dr de mnskliga rttigheterna respekteras\, skyddas och uppfylls\, genom std och kapacitetsutveckling till frndringsaktrer med legitimitet och frmga att arbeta rttighetsbaserat fr att utkrva ansvar av skyldighetsbrare och att strka rttighetsinnehavares organisering\, egenmakt och frutsttningar att sjlva frndra sina livsvillkor."

title_narrative: COVID-19 Swedish Mission Council frame 2017-2021,COVID-19 SMR Svenska missionsrdet\, insatsavtal 2017-2021
description_narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19SMR has submitted an additional application for Sida grants for 2018-2019 in total
122\,000\,000 SEK.

ADDITIONAL APPLICATION
Prior to this agreement period\, the Pentecostal Mission's development cooperation (PMU) has not been given renewed status as a framework organization at Sida and thus no longer receives direct support from the CSO grant. Instead\, PMU\, which is a member organization of SMR\, has chosen to apply for grants for projects in support of civil society in developing countries from SMR\, which pass on grants from the CSO grant. Prior to the current sub-agreement for the period 2017-2021\, SMR has already received an offer from Sida to supplement it with an additional application for the period 2018-2019\, which corresponds to SMR's assessment and recommendations for support to PMU. Subsequently\, PMU has submitted to SMR with an application for a grant from SMR for the period 2018-2019.

BUDGET
SMR is applying for a total of SEK 122\,000\,000 for the two-year period 2018-2019\, in addition to the already agreed amount of SEK 790\,000\,000. This is the same amount that the PMU applied for to SMR. SMR's total budget for the supplementary application 2018-2019 is SEK 134\,551\,400 (including SEK 12\,551\,400 in own contribution). The distribution between SMR\, their Swedish member organizations and the local partners changes somewhat for the period to which the supplementary application relates. Based on the total budget for the supplementary application 2018-2019\, the proportion staying with the Swedish member organizations increases from 13% to 19% and the proportion staying with the local partners decreases correspondingly from 81% to 75%. About 6% still stay with SMR.

BASIS FOR PAGE ASSESSMENT
The preparation has largely been based on SMR's input assessment of PMU's program application\, but also SMR's organizational assessment of PMU and Sida's follow-up of SMR and PMU in Kenya\, May 2017. Sida has also had access to PMU's program application to SMR\, and the PMU's response to SMR's supplementary questions regarding the application.

THE PREPARATION
Since the intervention is prepared as a supplementary intervention decision\, the preparation has\, as far as possible\, been based on the extensive preparation made of the application for the ongoing agreement period 2017-2021. As the assessment made of the application 2017-2021 is still relevant\, this has been retained and supplementary comments regarding 2018-2019 have been added where the additional application causes an updated supplementary assessment. The revisions made by the committee therefore only affect the period 2018-2019.,Omprogrammerade medel fr att bekmpa covid-19Omprogrammerade medel fr att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19SMR har inkommit med en tillggsanskan om Sida-bidrag fr 2018-2019 om totalt

description_narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19UNICEF WASH 2018-2021. A global thematic non-earmarked support for UNICEF work on water\, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) in line with their strategic plan 2018-2021. The programme has a strong focus on gender equality. The intervention is a thematic support; a financing modality promoted by the Swedish strategy "Strategi fr multilateral utvecklingspolitik" that gives larger room for efficiency and flexibility for the recipient organisation through internal budget allocations\, and thereby providing improved conditions for risk management and results based management during implementation. The modality requires Sida to base the assessment mainly on the organisation's internal systems instead of predetermined details on execution.,Omprogrammerade medel fr att bekmpa covid-19UNICEF WASH 2018-2021. Insatsen avser ett globalt flexibelt icke-ronmrkt tematiskt std till UNICEFs arbete inom vatten\, sanitet och hygien (WASH) i enlighet med den strategiska planen 2018-2021. Insatsen har ett starkt jmstlldhetsfokus.,The objective of the contribution is to support UNICEF to implement activities with the aim to contribute to "sustained use of safe water and sanitation services and adoption of hygiene practices and strengthened systems for a clean and safe environment for all children\, women\, girls and boys\, particularly the most disadvantaged and those affected by humanitarian situations" which is the outcome statement of UNICEF's goal area 4 "Every child lives in a safe and clean environment" as per UNICEF's Strategic Plan 2018-2021.

For the year 2022 the objectives are encompassed in the following two result areas of the new Strategic Plan (2022-2025)  under Goal Area 4: Every child\, including adolescents\, use safe\, equitable water\, sanitation and hygiene services and lives in a safe and sustainable climate and environment.

 Result Area 1: Sustained access to and use of safe water\, sanitation and hygiene practices
for all children and adolescents\, particularly the most disadvantaged and those living in
humanitarian and fragile contexts
 Result Area 2: Strengthened and resourced WASH systems for gender equal\, inclusive\,
affordable\, and sustainable services to meet the rights of all children and adolescents\,
particularly the most disadvantaged and those living in humanitarian and fragile contexts.
participating_org_narrative: Sweden,UNICEF/United Nations Children's Fund,Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency,UNICEF/United Nations Children's Fund

title_narrative: Programme d'Appui au Secteur Eau Hygine et Assainissement (PASEHA)\, 2007-2009
description_narrative:
Med udgangspunkt i Nigers fattigdomsstrategi vil programmet bidrage til at forbedre adgangen til bredygtig drikkevandsforsyning og til private og offentlige latriner\, samt til at forbedre hygiejnen p landet og i mindre byer. 

Programmet bestr af to komponenter: 1) sttte til drikkevandsforsyning\, hygiejne og sanitet (offentlige og private latriner) p landet med fokus p regionerne Zinder og Diffa; og 2) sttte til konkrete aktiviteter til opbygningen af forvaltningskapaciteten i de centrale og decentrale vandmyndigheder\, herunder etablering af et egentligt nationalt program for opfyldelsen af 2015-mlene for vandforsyning og sanitet. 

Programmet vil over en 3-rig periode dkke ca. 115.000 menneskers behov for drikkevand gennem etablering af nye brnde\, hndpumper og sm vandforsyningsanlg\, svel som forbedring\, rehabilitering og udvidelse af allerede eksisterende vandforsyningsinfrastruktur. En del af installationerne vil endvidere give mulighed for vanding af kvg og husdyr. Sikring af en bredygtig vedligeholdelse af installationerne gennem inddragelse af den private sektor og de nyetablerede kommuner vil vre et centralt tema i sttten. Befolkningen vil endvidere have gennemget intensiv hygiejneundervisning i hjemmet\, og mindst 3.000 hjem vil vre forsynet med latriner.

P det forvaltningsmssige plan vil sektorsttten bidrage til at formulere et nationalt sektorprogram for vandforsyning og sanitet\, der i fremtiden skal fungere som en samlende planlgningsramme for svel donorer som nationale aktrer ledende hen imod opnelsen af 2015 mlene p vand- og sanitet\, samt til at sikre en bredygtig forvaltning og udnyttelse af landets sparsomme vandressourcer.

Programmet er lukket. Programmets aktiviteter blev gennemfrt og afsluttet i perioden 2009-2012.
participating_org_narrative: COWI A/S,Ministry of Foreign Affairs\, Denmark
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
sector_narrative: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation,Water Supply & Sanitation

title_narrative: Programme d'Appui au Secteur Eau Hygine et Assainissement (PASEHA)\, 2007-2009
description_narrative:
Med udgangspunkt i Nigers fattigdomsstrategi vil programmet bidrage til at forbedre adgangen til bredygtig drikkevandsforsyning og til private og offentlige latriner\, samt til at forbedre hygiejnen p landet og i mindre byer. 

Programmet bestr af to komponenter: 1) sttte til drikkevandsforsyning\, hygiejne og sanitet (offentlige og private latriner) p landet med fokus p regionerne Zinder og Diffa; og 2) sttte til konkrete aktiviteter til opbygningen af forvaltningskapaciteten i de centrale og decentrale vandmyndigheder\, herunder etablering af et egentligt nationalt program for opfyldelsen af 2015-mlene for vandforsyning og sanitet. 

Programmet vil over en 3-rig periode dkke ca. 115.000 menneskers behov for drikkevand gennem etablering af nye brnde\, hndpumper og sm vandforsyningsanlg\, svel som forbedring\, rehabilitering og udvidelse af allerede eksisterende vandforsyningsinfrastruktur. En del af installationerne vil endvidere give mulighed for vanding af kvg og husdyr. Sikring af en bredygtig vedligeholdelse af installationerne gennem inddragelse af den private sektor og de nyetablerede kommuner vil vre et centralt tema i sttten. Befolkningen vil endvidere have gennemget intensiv hygiejneundervisning i hjemmet\, og mindst 3.000 hjem vil vre forsynet med latriner.

P det forvaltningsmssige plan vil sektorsttten bidrage til at formulere et nationalt sektorprogram for vandforsyning og sanitet\, der i fremtiden skal fungere som en samlende planlgningsramme for svel donorer som nationale aktrer ledende hen imod opnelsen af 2015 mlene p vand- og sanitet\, samt til at sikre en bredygtig forvaltning og udnyttelse af landets sparsomme vandressourcer.

Programmet er lukket. Programmets aktiviteter blev gennemfrt og afsluttet i perioden 2009-2012.
participating_org_narrative: COWI A/S,Ministry of Foreign Affairs\, Denmark
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
sector_narrative: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation,Water Supply & Sanitation

P det forvaltningsmssige plan vil sektorsttten bidrage til at formulere et nationalt sektorprogram for vandforsyning og sanitet\, der i fremtiden skal fungere som en samlende planlgningsramme for svel donorer som nationale aktrer ledende hen imod opnelsen af 2015 mlene p vand- og sanitet\, samt til at sikre en bredygtig forvaltning og udnyttelse af landets sparsomme vandressourcer.

Programmet er lukket. Programmets aktiviteter blev gennemfrt og afsluttet i perioden 2009-2012.

title_narrative: Programme d'Appui au Secteur Eau Hygine et Assainissement (PASEHA)\, 2007-2009
description_narrative:
Med udgangspunkt i Nigers fattigdomsstrategi vil programmet bidrage til at forbedre adgangen til bredygtig drikkevandsforsyning og til private og offentlige latriner\, samt til at forbedre hygiejnen p landet og i mindre byer. 

Programmet bestr af to komponenter: 1) sttte til drikkevandsforsyning\, hygiejne og sanitet (offentlige og private latriner) p landet med fokus p regionerne Zinder og Diffa; og 2) sttte til konkrete aktiviteter til opbygningen af forvaltningskapaciteten i de centrale og decentrale vandmyndigheder\, herunder etablering af et egentligt nationalt program for opfyldelsen af 2015-mlene for vandforsyning og sanitet. 

Programmet vil over en 3-rig periode dkke ca. 115.000 menneskers behov for drikkevand gennem etablering af nye brnde\, hndpumper og sm vandforsyningsanlg\, svel som forbedring\, rehabilitering og udvidelse af allerede eksisterende vandforsyningsinfrastruktur. Programmet bestr af to komponenter: 1) sttte til drikkevandsforsyning\, hygiejne og sanitet (offentlige og private latriner) p landet med fokus p regionerne Zinder og Diffa; og 2) sttte til konkrete aktiviteter til opbygningen af forvaltningskapaciteten i de centrale og decentrale vandmyndigheder\, herunder etablering af et egentligt nationalt program for opfyldelsen af 2015-mlene for vandforsyning og sanitet. 

Programmet vil over en 3-rig periode dkke ca. 115.000 menneskers behov for drikkevand gennem etablering af nye brnde\, hndpumper og sm vandforsyningsanlg\, svel som forbedring\, rehabilitering og udvidelse af allerede eksisterende vandforsyningsinfrastruktur. En del af installationerne vil endvidere give mulighed for vanding af kvg og husdyr. Sikring af en bredygtig vedligeholdelse af installationerne gennem inddragelse af den private sektor og de nyetablerede kommuner vil vre et centralt tema i sttten. Befolkningen vil endvidere have gennemget intensiv hygiejneundervisning i hjemmet\, og mindst 3.000 hjem vil vre forsynet med latriner.

P det forvaltningsmssige plan vil sektorsttten bidrage til at formulere et nationalt sektorprogram for vandforsyning og sanitet\, der i fremtiden skal fungere som en samlende planlgningsramme for svel donorer som nationale aktrer ledende hen imod opnelsen af 2015 mlene p vand- og sanitet\, samt til at sikre en bredygtig forvaltning og udnyttelse af landets sparsomme vandressourcer.

Programmet er lukket. Programmets aktiviteter blev gennemfrt og afsluttet i perioden 2009-2012.
participating_org_narrative: Ministry of Water\, Environment and the Fight Against Desertification,Ministry of Foreign Affairs\, Denmark
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
sector_narrative: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation,Water Supply & Sanitation

reporting_org_narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands
description_narrative: Despite its important sources Niger suffers greatly from chronic shortages of water\, due to factors such as inequal spreading of pre cipitation. Access to drinking water in rural areas ranges from 35 to 63\,5%; access to sanitation in rural areas is as low as 1\,7%. The Government of Niger (GoN) is compelled to find solutions to provide access to WASH\, also in view of the rapidly growing population. To address this challenge the GoN in 2017 has adopted a sectoriel WASH program (PROSEHA) in the framework of Agenda 2030 with two objectives: secure acccess to WASH for all and to contribute to a national stratgy for rural watersupply. Untill 2030 EUR 5\,1 billion is needed to arrive at the set targets. For the first phase (untill 2020) Niger wants to support 25% of the households in rural areas and 80% of the households in urban areas with optimal drinking water and  17\,2% of the household in rural areas and 23\,87% of the households in urban areas with accesss to optimal sanitation.  Luxembourg and Denmark have decided on a delegated cooperation to execute the Luxembourg program for support to WASH (PASEHA 3). It is executed by Luxemburg Development Cooperation. Support will be channeled through a common financing mechanism (MCF) that was put in place by the GoN to align development efforts in the fie ld of WASH and to secure extra funds for PROSEHA. Luxembourg and Denmark have provided EUR 47 million in total. The Dutch contribution will support relevant activities in the border areas with Burkina Faso\, namely Tahoua and Tillabry. Technica assistance will be part of the program.
participating_org_narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands,Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands,Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands,Luxembourg Development Cooperation
sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
sector_narrative: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
transaction_provider_org_narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands

reporting_org_narrative: Foreign Affairs\, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD),Affaires trangres\, Commerce et Dveloppement Canada (MAECD)
title_narrative: Poverty Reduction Local Fund - Phase II,Fonds d'appui  la lutte contre la pauvret - phase II
description_narrative: The Poverty Reduction Local Fund - Phase II (FALP II) responds to proposals from non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and development associations active in Niger. The funded initiatives helped to build the institutional capacities of partner organizations and to give the poorest\, mainly women and children\, better access to social services and basic nutrition. FALP II focuses its support on the Maradi\, Tillaberi\, and Tahoua regions.,Le Fonds d'appui  la lutte contre la pauvret\, phase II (FALP II) rpond  des propositions dorganisations non gouvernementales (ONG) et dassociations de dveloppement oeuvrant au Niger. Les initiatives ainsi appuyes ont contribu au renforcement des capacits institutionnelles des organisations partenaires et  un meilleur accs  des services sociaux ainsi qu' une meilleure alimentation de base pour les populations les plus dmunies\, principalement les femmes et les enfants. Le FALP II concentre ses appuis dans les rgions de Maradi\, Tillabri et Tahoua.
participating_org_narrative: Canada,Canada,Canadian International Development Agency,Agence canadienne de dveloppement international,Embassy of Canada to Niger,Ambassade du Canada au Niger

reporting_org_narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
title_narrative: Programme dHydraulique Rurale  Appui Au Secteur Eau et Assainissement (PHRASEA) Phase 2
description_narrative: Moins de 50% des nigriens ont accs  leau potable et seuls 7% disposent de conditions d'assainissement de base. La croissance dmographique galopante\, la dispersion de la population sur le territoire et la prcarit des finances publiques sont des contraintes empchant l'accs des populations  ces services de base. Le PHRASEA vient en appui aux efforts du gouvernement\, en misant sur la maitrise douvrage des communes.

title_narrative: Projet intercommunal eau et assainissement (canton d'Illla - Niger)
description_narrative: Le projet vise  amliorer durablement l'accs  l'eau et  l'assainissement dans les 4 communes du canton d'Illla (Niger) en renforant la gouvernance communale et intercommunale des services de l'eau et de l'assainissement (E&A)\, en favorisant l'accs  l'eau potable\, l'hygine et  l'assainissement\, des populations des 4 communes et en structurant les oprateurs locaux de gestion du service E&A. Les bnficiaires sonles populations des 23 villages touchs par le projet\, soit 30 000 personnes

reporting_org_narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre
title_narrative: Providing drinking water in the Republic of Niger.
description_narrative:
- Drilling of (163) surface wells ranging from (20 to 30 meters).
- Installation of 163 hand pumps.,1- Implementing sustainable activities to provide safe drinking water to (241\,880 beneficiaries) by digging (163) surface wells.
2- Contribute to reducing the percentage of diseases resulting from drinking contaminated water.
3- Providing water for livestock\, on which the economy of the population in the targeted areas depends.
4- To contribute to stabilizing the population and limiting desertion in order to obtain water sources.
5- Increasing sources of safe drinking water and personal use in dry areas.
6- An increase in the percentage of crop productivity in the targeted areas.,About (241\,880) beneficiaries have access to safe drinking water and daily use in each of the following areas (Dosso / Tillaberi / Tawa).
participating_org_narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre,Al-Wafa World Organization
sector: Basic drinking water supply

reporting_org_narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre
title_narrative: Drilling (6) surface wells in Tlabri\, Republic of Niger
description_narrative: Providing potable water to the citizens of Niger by digging and preparing wells,Providing a source of safe water for drinking and personal use in the targeted areas with humanitarian needs\, reducing the rate of epidemic diseases\, supporting the economy by providing water for livestock\, which is a source of livelihood for the residents of the targeted areas\, limiting the migration of residents of the area and enhancing living there.,Providing drinking water for personal use to (60\,699) beneficiaries\, preserving livestock and enhancing the local and national economy\, in addition to limiting the spread of epidemic diseases and promoting personal hygiene in a clean and safe environment in the targeted areas.
participating_org_narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre,Al-Wafa World Organization
sector: Basic drinking water supply

reporting_org_narrative: Foreign Affairs\, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD),Affaires trangres\, Commerce et Dveloppement Canada (MAECD)
title_narrative: Poverty Reduction Local Fund - Phase II,Fonds d'appui  la lutte contre la pauvret - phase II
description_narrative: The Poverty Reduction Local Fund - Phase II (FALP II) responds to proposals from non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and development associations active in Niger. The funded initiatives helped to build the institutional capacities of partner organizations and to give the poorest\, mainly women and children\, better access to social services and basic nutrition. FALP II focuses its support on the Maradi\, Tillaberi\, and Tahoua regions.,Le Fonds d'appui  la lutte contre la pauvret\, phase II (FALP II) rpond  des propositions dorganisations non gouvernementales (ONG) et dassociations de dveloppement oeuvrant au Niger. Les initiatives ainsi appuyes ont contribu au renforcement des capacits institutionnelles des organisations partenaires et  un meilleur accs  des services sociaux ainsi qu' une meilleure alimentation de base pour les populations les plus dmunies\, principalement les femmes et les enfants. Le FALP II concentre ses appuis dans les rgions de Maradi\, Tillabri et Tahoua.
participating_org_narrative: Canada,Canada,Canadian International Development Agency,Agence canadienne de dveloppement international,Embassy of Canada to Niger,Ambassade du Canada au Niger
contact_info_organisation_narrative: Foreign Affairs\, Trade and Development Canada (DFATD),Affaires trangres\, Commerce et Dveloppement Canada (MAECD)
sector: Basic sanitation

description_narrative: Depuis la reprise des combats entre les armes nationales de quatre pays et le groupe arm Boko Haram en 2015\, provoquant le dplacement massif de plus de 2\,6 million de personnes  travers la rgion\, la pression sur les ressources des communauts htes et les infrastructures existantes s'est trouve dcuple\, notamment au Niger. Le prsent projet vise  renforcer l'quipe technique de l'UNICEF de ce pays\, laquelle supervise la coordination des projets humanitaires relatifs  l'eau\, l'hygine et  l'assainissement.

title_narrative: Development of a roadmap for an inclusive and sustainable water governance structure for the river Niger in Niger
description_narrative: The purpose of this project is to contribute an expert planning perspective to the development of a roadmap that will lead to an inclusive and sustainable water governance structure for the river Niger in Niger (country). Good governance of the area of the river is essential for the livelihood of millions of people\, the economy of the country and to prevent conflicts. Especially in the context of rapid climate change and extreme weather (and floods) occurring more often. This project will facilitate the planning process for the development of this roadmap in the beginning of 2021.
participating_org_narrative: Netherlands Enterprise Agency,Van Beek Water Delft,Netherlands Enterprise Agency
sector: River basins development

title_narrative: Project for the installation of a water retention for the regulation of the Sirba river
description_narrative: The project involves the construction of an earth-filled dam\, due to store approx. 7.5 million m3 of water and the development of 70 hectares of arable land near the village of Toure\, in the municipality of Gotheye (Tillabery\, southwestern Niger).,Il progetto prevede la costruzione di una ritenuta d'acqua in terra per potere stoccare ca. 7\,5 milioni di m3 d'acqua e la sistemazione di 70 ettari di terreni nei pressi del villaggio di Toure\, nel comune di Gotheye\, nella regione sud-occidentale nigerina di Tillabery.

reporting_org_narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development
title_narrative: Pilot action for job creation and waste enhancement in the City of Niamey
description_narrative: The overall objective of the project is to improve the living conditions of the local population by promoting education to respect the environment by reducing the impact of Niamey's plastics waste\, bringing the current quantity into a sample neighborhood\, from 18% without intervention at 28%\, on an annual basis\, with intervention\, on an annual basis.,Lobiettivo generale del progetto  quello di migliorare le condizioni di vita della popolazione locale promuovendo leducazione al rispetto dellambiente riducendo limpatto dei rifiuti plastici di Niamey\, portando il quantitativo attuale raccolto in un quartiere esempio\, dal 18% senza intervento al 28%\, su base annua\, con intervento.
